Basil Butter.directions: Mince 2 ounces (60 grams) fresh basil and 2 ounces (60 grams) shallots; add to the butter with 2 teaspoons (10 milliliters) lemon juice.
Basil Butter.name: Basil Butter

Salisbury Steak.directions: SautÃ© the mirepoix in the oil until tender. Add the thyme, marjoram, pepper and salt. Remove from the pan, cool, and refrigerate until cold. Combine the mirepoix with the cornflake crumbs, eggs, Worcestershire sauce and milk and mix well. Add the beef, adjust the seasonings and mix well. Make a small patty and cook it. Taste it to check the seasonings and adjust them if necessary. Scale forty 5-ounce (150-gram) portions of the mixture. Alternatively, use a slightly rounded #8 scoop to portion the mixture. Form each portion into a flattened football-shaped patty and place on a baking sheet. Bake the Salisbury steaks at 325Â°F (160Â°C) until done, approximately 10 to 15 minutes. Serve with mushroom sauce.
Salisbury Steak.name: Salisbury Steak

Lemon Rind.directions: Wash lemon.                                                                                          2) Peel yellow rind, avoiding white pith.                                         3) Dice or julienne with sharp knife
Lemon Rind.name: Lemon Rind

Balsamic Vinaigrette.directions: 1 In a stainless steel bowl, whisk together the vinegar, mustard, shallots, salt and pepper. 2 Combine the oils. Slowly whisk them into the vinegar-and-mustard mixture to form an emul-sified dressing.
Balsamic Vinaigrette.name: Balsamic Vinaigrette

Foyot Sauce.directions: Add to bÃ©arnaise 3 fluid ounces (90 milliliters) melted glace de viande.
Foyot Sauce.name: Foyot Sauce

Veal Marsala.directions: Season the scallops with salt and pepper. Dredge the scallops in flour and sautÃ© them in a mixture of the clarified butter and oil, a few at a time, until all are cooked. Remove the scallops and set aside. Degrease the pan and deglaze with the wine. Add the stock and reduce until it begins to thicken. Return the scallops to the sauce to reheat. Remove the scallops to plates or a serving platter. Reduce the sauce until it becomes syrupy; adjust the seasonings. MontÃ© au beurre and spoon the sauce over the veal. Serve the veal with mashed potatoes and cooked baby carrots or other garnishes.
Veal Marsala.name: Veal Marsala

Cooked Long-Grain Rice.directions: Bring the water and salt to a boil in a heavy saucepan. Slowly add the rice. Cover the pan and reduce the heat so that the liquid simmers gently. Cook until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed, approximately 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and transfer to a hotel pan. Do not cover. Allow any excess moisture to evaporate for approximately 5 minutes. Fluff the rice and serve, or refrigerate for use in another recipe.
Cooked Long-Grain Rice.name: Cooked Long-Grain Rice

Fresh Cranberry-Orange Relish.directions: Combine the sugar, orange juice and water in a nonreactive rondeau or saucepan; bring to a boil. Add the cranberries and cinnamon stick and simmer uncovered until the berries begin to burst, approximately 15 minutes. Skim off any foam that rises to the surface. Add the orange liqueur and zest and simmer for another 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and remove the cinnamon stick. Add the orange segments. Cool and refrigerate. Serve with roasted game, poultry or charcuterie items. VARIATION: JalapeÃ±o-Cranberry Relishâ€”Omit the orange liqueur, zest and segments. Add 1 fresh jalapeÃ±o pepper, minced, and 1â„2 cup (120 milliliters) hot pepper jelly.
Fresh Cranberry-Orange Relish.name: Fresh Cranberry-Orange Relish

Minute Steak Dijonaise.directions: Pound the steaks to a 1â„4-inch (6-millimeter) thickness. Cover one side of each sirloin first with 11â„2 teaspoons (8 milliliters) mustard and then half of the onion, pressing the onion firmly into the steak. SautÃ© the steaks in the clarified butter, presentation (onion) side down first. Remove and hold in a warm place. Degrease the pan. Add the cream and reduce by half. Add the rest of the mustard. MontÃ© au beurre. Adjust the seasonings. Serve each portion with some of the sauce.
Minute Steak Dijonaise.name: Minute Steak Dijonaise

Chevreuil Sauce.directions: Prepare a poivrade sauce but add 6 ounces (180 grams) bacon or game trimmings to the mirepoix. Finish with 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) red wine and a dash of cayenne pepper. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Chevreuil Sauce.name: Chevreuil Sauce

Grapefruit Juice (fresh).directions: Directions: Wash grapefruits in cold water Using electric or hand juicer, juice into a fine mesh strainer over a clean (non-reactive) container. Refrigerate.
Grapefruit Juice (fresh).name: Grapefruit Juice (fresh)

Raspberry Sauce.directions: PurÃ©e the berries and strain through a fine chinois. Stir in the sugar and lemon juice. Adjust the flavor with additional sugar if necessary.
Raspberry Sauce.name: Raspberry Sauce

Caesar Dressing.directions: 1 Combine the garlic, eggs, Parmesan, vinegars, mustards, anchovies, salt and pepper in the bowl of a food processor and process until smooth, approximately 1 minute. 2 With the machine running slowly, begin adding the oils to form an emulsion. 3 Continue until all the oil is incorporated.
Caesar Dressing.name: Caesar Dressing

Grilled Lamb Chops with Herb Butter.directions: Preheat the grill for 15 minutes. Brush the lamb chops with oil; season with salt and pepper. Place the lamb chops on the grill, turning as necessary to produce the proper crosshatching. Cook to the desired doneness. Remove the lamb chops from the grill and place a slice or rosette of herb butter on each chop. Serve immediately as the herb butter melts. The plate can be placed under the broiler for a few seconds to help melt the herb butter.
Grilled Lamb Chops with Herb Butter.name: Grilled Lamb Chops with Herb Butter

Almond Cream.directions: Cream the butter and sugar. Slowly add the eggs, scraping down the bowl as necessary. Stir the flour and almonds together, then add to the butter mixture. Blend until no lumps re-main. Almond cream may be stored under refrigeration for up to 3 weeks.
Almond Cream.name: Almond Cream

Orange Zest.directions: Wash orange Zest orange part of rind, avoiding white pith.
Orange Zest.name: Orange Zest

English Muffin Loaves.directions: Stir together the yeast, sugar, baking soda, salt and 12 ounces (360 grams) flour. Combine the milk and water and heat to 120Â°F (49Â°C). Stir the warm liquids into the dry ingredients, beating well. Add enough of the remaining flour to make a stiff batter. Spoon the batter into loaf pans that have been greased and dusted with cornmeal. Proof until doubled. Bake at 400Â°F (200Â°C) until golden brown and done, approximately 25 minutes.
English Muffin Loaves.name: English Muffin Loaves

Game Stock.directions: Cut the pheasant into pieces. Take the breast meat off the frame and reserve for other use. Place pheasant, quail, and trimmings in a stockpot and cover with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.
Game Stock.name: Game Stock

P\u00c3\u00a2t\u00c3\u00a9 Spice.directions: Grind all the ingredients in a spice grinder. Pass through a sieve to remove any large pieces. VARIATION: This mixture can be used as is, or mix 1 ounce (30 grams) (or any amount desired) with 1 pound (480 grams) salt. The salt-and-spice mixture can then be used to season forcemeats; 1/3 ounce (10 grams) per pound of forcemeat usually suffices for most pÃ¢tÃ©s.
P\u00c3\u00a2t\u00c3\u00a9 Spice.name: PÃ¢tÃ© Spice

Tomato Syrup.directions: 1 In a nonreactive saucepan, reduce the tomato juice by two-thirds. Add the remaining ingredi-ents, stir well and strain through a chinois.
Tomato Syrup.name: Tomato Syrup

Grilled Veal Chop with Wild Mushroom Rag.directions: Brush the veal chops with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill over a hot grill to the de-sired doneness. Arrange each chop with side dishes as desired; top with Wild Mushroom RagoÃ»t.
Grilled Veal Chop with Wild Mushroom Rag.name: Grilled Veal Chop with Wild Mushroom RagoÃ»t

Cinnamon French Toast.directions: Whisk together the eggs, cream, salt and cinnamon. Place the egg mixture in a shallow pan. Place the slices of bread in the egg mixture and let soak for 2 to 3 minutes, turning them over after the first minute or so. Cook the slices of French toast in a lightly buttered, preheated sautÃ© pan or griddle set at 350Â°F (180Â°C) until well browned. Turn the slices and cook on the second side until done. Cut each slice of bread into two triangles. Arrange four triangles on each plate and dust with powdered sugar.
Cinnamon French Toast.name: Cinnamon French Toast

Wild Mushroom Rago\u00c3\u00bbt.directions: Render the bacon in a saucepot. Add the garlic, shallot, leeks, onions and thyme and sautÃ© until tender. Add the mushrooms and sautÃ© for 5 minutes. Deglaze with the wine and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes. Add the demi-glace and reduce to the desired consistency, approximately 15 minutes. Add the tomato concassÃ©e, adjust the seasonings and hold for service.
Wild Mushroom Rago\u00c3\u00bbt.name: Wild Mushroom RagoÃ»t

Focaccia (Roman Flatbread).directions: Combine the sugar, yeast and water. Stir to dissolve the yeast. Stir in the flour 4 ounces (120 grams) at a time. Stir in 1 1/2 teaspoons (7 milliliters) salt and the onion. Mix well, then knead on a lightly floured board or in the bowl of a mixer fitted with a dough hook until smooth. Place the dough in an oiled bowl, cover and ferment until doubled. Punch down the dough, then flatten it onto an oiled sheet pan. It should be no more than 1 inch (2.5 centimeters) thick. Brush the top of the dough with the olive oil. Let the dough proof until doubled, approximately 15 minutes. Sprinkle the rosemary and remaining 1/2 teaspoon (2 milliliters) salt on top of the dough. Bake at 400Â°F (200Â°C) until lightly browned, approximately 20 minutes.
Focaccia (Roman Flatbread).name: Focaccia (Roman Flatbread)

Pizza Dough.directions: Stir the yeast into the warm water to dissolve. Add the flour. Stir the remaining ingredients into the flour mixture. Knead with a dough hook or by hand until smooth and elastic, approximately 5 minutes. Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl and cover. Allow the dough to ferment in a warm place for 30 minutes. Punch down the dough and divide into portions. The dough may be wrapped and refrigerated for up to 2 days. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough into very thin rounds and top as desired. Bake at 400Â°F (200Â°C) until crisp and golden brown, approximately 8 to 12 minutes.
Pizza Dough.name: Pizza Dough

Tomato Butter Sauce with Thyme.directions: SautÃ© the tomato concassÃ©e in the oil for approximately 2 minutes. Lower the heat to a simmer and reduce the tomato until thick but not dry. In a saucepan, combine the wine, vermouth, vinegar and shallot. Bring to a boil and reduce au sec. Add the cream and reduce by half. Add the thyme, salt and pepper to the tomatoes. Stir in the wine, cream and shallot reduction. Bring the sauce to a simmer. Add the butter pieces and stir until incorporated. Do not allow the sauce to boil or the butter will separate. Adjust the seasonings and stir in the parsley.
Tomato Butter Sauce with Thyme.name: Tomato Butter Sauce with Thyme

Chocolate Souffl\u00c3\u00a9s.directions: To prepare the base, heat the orange juice to lukewarm in a heavy saucepan. Whisk the egg yolks with 3 ounces (90 grams) sugar in a large mixing bowl. Whisk in the flour and warm orange juice, then return the mixture to the saucepan. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until the custard is thick. Do not allow it to boil. Remove from the heat. Stir in the chocolate until completely melted. Stir in the liqueur. Cover this base mixture with plastic wrap to prevent a skin from forming. Hold for use at room temperature. (Unused base can be kept overnight in the refrigerator; it should be brought to room temperature before mixing with the egg whites.) To prepare the soufflÃ©s, brush 4-fluid-ounce (120-milliliter) ramekins with melted butter and dust with granulated sugar. Preheat the oven to 425Â°F (220Â°C). Place a sheet pan in the oven, onto which you will place the soufflÃ©s for baking. (This makes it easier to remove the hot soufflÃ© cups from the oven.) Whip the egg whites to stiff peaks with the remaining 1 ounce (30 grams) sugar. Fold the whites into the chocolate base and spoon the mixture into the prepared ramekins. The ramekins should be filled to within 1/4 inch (6 millimeters) of the rim. Smooth the top of each soufflÃ© with a spatula and bake immediately. The soufflÃ©s are done when well risen, brown on top and the edges appear dry, approximately 12 minutes. Do not touch a soufflÃ© to test doneness. Sprinkle the soufflÃ©s with powdered sugar if desired and serve immediately.
Chocolate Souffl\u00c3\u00a9s.name: Chocolate SoufflÃ©s

Streusel Topping.directions: Combine the dry ingredients. Cut in the butter until the mixture is coarse and crumbly. Sprinkle on top of muffins or quick breads before baking. Streusel topping will keep for sev-eral weeks under refrigeration and may be frozen for longer storage. There is no need to thaw before use.
Streusel Topping.name: Streusel Topping

Curried Chickpea Crisps.directions: 1 In a stainless steel bowl, stir together the dry ingredients. Form a pool in the middle of the mixture and add the liquid ingredients. Mix together by hand, adding additional flour if nec-essary. Knead until smooth and elastic, approximately 5 minutes. 2 Roll out the dough using a pasta machine to thickness number 6. Using a ravioli cutter, cut the dough into   (5-centimeter ï‚´ 6-millimeter) strips. 3 Using the swimming method, deep-fry the strips at 275Â°F (135Â°C) for 3 minutes. Season with salt and hold warm.
Curried Chickpea Crisps.name: Curried Chickpea Crisps

Spanish Sauce.directions: Prepare creole sauce as directed, adding 4 ounces (120 grams) sliced mushrooms to the sautÃ©ed onions. Garnish with sliced black or green olives. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Spanish Sauce.name: Spanish Sauce

Shrimp and Avocado Omelet.directions: SautÃ© the shrimp and onion in half of the butter until the shrimp is firm and the onion is translucent, approximately 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside. Heat an omelet pan and add the remaining butter. Whisk the eggs together in a small bowl, season with salt and pepper and pour into the ome-let pan. Stir the eggs as they cook. Stop when they begin to set. Lift the edges as the omelet cooks to allow the raw eggs to run underneath. When the eggs are nearly set, add the shrimp filling, avocado and cilantro. Fold the front of the eggs over and roll the omelet onto a plate.
Shrimp and Avocado Omelet.name: Shrimp and Avocado Omelet

Lamb Noisettes.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim lamb of all excess fat and sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut ribeye into noisettes. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Lamb Noisettes.name: Lamb Noisettes

Chocolate Italian Buttercream.directions: All ingredients should be at room temperature before beginning. Place the egg whites in a mixer bowl. Have 9 ounces (270 grams) sugar nearby. Place 1 pound 2 ounces (540 grams) sugar in a heavy saucepan with enough water to moisten. Bring to a boil over high heat, brushing down the sides of the pan with clean water to prevent the sugar from crystallizing. As the sugar syrupâ€™s temperature approaches soft ball stage (240Â°F/116Â°C), begin whipping the egg whites. Watch the sugar closely so that the temperature does not exceed 240Â°F (116Â°C). When soft peaks form in the egg whites, gradually add 9 ounces (270 grams) sugar to them. Reduce the mixer speed to medium and continue whipping the egg whites to stiff peaks. When the sugar syrup reaches soft ball stage, immediately pour it into the whites while the mixer is running. Pour the syrup in a steady stream between the side of the bowl and the bea-ter. If the syrup hits the beater, it will splatter and cause lumps. Continue beating at medium speed until the egg whites are completely cool. At this point, the product is known as Italian meringue. Gradually add the softened butter to the Italian meringue. When all the butter is incorporated, add flavoring ingredients as desired. 8  Add 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) vanilla extract to the butter-cream, then stir in 10 ounces (300 grams) melted and cooled bittersweet chocolate.
Chocolate Italian Buttercream.name: Chocolate Italian Buttercream

Chicken And Sausage Gumbo.directions: Combine the cayenne pepper, paprika, white pepper and black pepper. Season the chicken with 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) salt and 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) of the pepper mix. Dust the chicken with some of the flour. Pan-fry the chicken in 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) oil until well browned. Remove the chicken from the pan and reserve. Strain the oil used to brown the chicken in order to remove burnt particles. Return the strained oil to the pan. Add 16 fluid ounces (480 milliliters) fresh vegetable oil. Over me-dium heat, add the remaining flour while stirring with a whisk to make a roux. Cook the roux very slowly over medium heat, stirring often, until it becomes a copper-brown color, ap-proximately 45 minutes to 1 hour. Add the onions, celery, bell peppers, garlic, filÃ© powder, bay leaves and the remaining salt and pepper mix. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the stock and bring to a simmer. Skim the fat from the surface and cook for approximately 11â„2 hours, skimming occasionally. When the strong roux flavor fades, add the reserved chicken and the andouille. Cook the gumbo for 1 more hour, skimming regularly. SautÃ© the okra in the remaining 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) oil, drain and add to the gumbo. Adjust the seasonings with the salt, pepper, cayenne, filÃ© powder, hot sauce or other seasonings as desired. Serve each portion of gumbo with 1 to 2 tablespoons (15 to 30 milliliters) cooked rice and garnish with sliced green onion tops.
Chicken And Sausage Gumbo.name: Chicken And Sausage Gumbo

Dough for P\u00c3\u00a2t\u00c3\u00a9.directions: Place the flour in the bowl of a mixer. Add the shortening and mix on low speed until smooth. Combine the salt, water and egg; add them to the flour and shortening mixture. Knead until smooth and refrigerate. The dough will be easier to work with if allowed to rest for at least 1 hour. Assembling, Baking and Glazing PÃ¢tÃ©  After preparing a forcemeat and pastry dough, all that remains is to assemble and bake the pÃ¢tÃ© en croÃ»te. The amount of pastry dough and forcemeat needed is determined by the size of the mold or pan chosen. Once the pÃ¢tÃ© is baked and cooled, aspic jelly is poured into holes in the dough to fill the space created when the pÃ¢tÃ© shrank during cooking. Slices of pÃ¢tÃ© can also be glazed with aspic for a more formal presentation.
Dough for P\u00c3\u00a2t\u00c3\u00a9.name: Dough for PÃ¢tÃ©

Cream Of Tomato Soup.directions: Sweat the mirepoix in the oil and butter in a heavy saucepan without caramelizing. Deglaze the pan with the tomato juice. Add the water, crushed tomatoes, salt, pepper and sa-chet. Bring to a boil, reduce to a low simmer and cook for 30 minutes. Stir in the Worcestershire sauce and thyme. Continue simmering for 15 minutes. Remove the sachet and purÃ©e the soup with an immersion blender until smooth. Strain the scalded cream through a china cap and add it to the soup. Simmer for 5 minutes; adjust the seasonings and serve.
Cream Of Tomato Soup.name: Cream Of Tomato Soup

Brown Stock.directions: Place the bones in a roasting pan, one layer deep, and brown in a 375Â°F (190Â°C) oven. Turn the bones occasionally to brown them evenly. Remove the bones and place them in a stockpot. Pour off the fat from the roasting pan and reserve it. Deglaze the roasting pan with part of the cold water. Add the deglazing liquor and the rest of the cold water to the bones, covering them completely. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Add a portion of the reserved fat to the roasting pan and sautÃ© the mirepoix until evenly browned. Then add it to the simmering stock. Add the tomato paste and sachet to the stock and continue to simmer for 6 to 8 hours, skim-ming as necessary. Strain, cool and refrigerate. Note: can use Veal Bones
Brown Stock.name: Brown Stock

Decorative Cookie Icing.directions: Combine the powdered sugar, lemon juice, corn syrup and vanilla in the bowl of a mixer fit-ted with the paddle attachment. Blend on low speed until the sugar dissolves and the mixture is smooth. Adjust the consistency of the icing by adding more water if necessary. Color as needed. Apply the icing to cookies and let them air dry until the icing hardens. Cover leftover icing and store it in the refrigerator, where it will keep about 3 weeks.
Decorative Cookie Icing.name: Decorative Cookie Icing

Beef Fajitas.directions: Make the marinade by chopping and mashing the garlic into a paste. In a bowl, combine the garlic paste with the remaining marinade ingredients. Trim the fat from the skirt steak. Cut the steak into two or three pieces if necessary. Add the steaks to the marinade, turning them several times to coat all sides. Cover the steak and mari-nate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or overnight. Grill the steak on a hot grill to the desired doneness. Remove the steak and allow it to rest for 10 minutes. Add the oil to a heavy sautÃ© pan, heat the pan until very hot and sautÃ© the bell peppers, onion and garlic just until they begin to soften. Slice the steak against the grain into thin slices. Arrange the steak and the pepper mixture on very hot cast-iron platters and garnish with the cilantro. The platters should be sizzling as they are presented to the table. Serve the fajitas accompanied by warm flour or corn tortillas, fresh salsa, sour cream, and guacamole.
Beef Fajitas.name: Beef Fajitas

Ricotta Cheese.directions: Allow the milk to reach room temperature in a covered container. In a stainless steel saucepan slowly heat the milk to 180Â°F (82Â°C), stirring often. Hold the heated milk at 180Â°F (82Â°C) for 5 minutes. Remove the milk from the heat and gently stir it while adding the lime juice. Continue to stir until curds form. Gently pour the curds into a strainer or china cap lined with new, rinsed cheesecloth. Allow the whey (liquid) to separate and drain away from the curds (solids). Discard the whey. Allow the cheese to rest undisturbed for 1 hour. For a firm, dry ricotta, lift the corners of the cheesecloth and tie them together with twine. Suspend the bag in a tall, covered container, place it in the refrigerator and allow the cheese to drain for 4 hours or overnight. Unwrap the cheese. Season it with salt if desired. Use the cheese as you would use commer-cially produced ricotta.
Ricotta Cheese.name: Ricotta Cheese

Lemon R\u00c3\u00a9moulade.directions: Mix all the ingredients together until thoroughly blended.
Lemon R\u00c3\u00a9moulade.name: Lemon RÃ©moulade

Normandy Sauce.directions: Add 4 ounces (120 grams) mushroom trimmings and 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) fish stock to 1 quart (960 milliliters) fish veloutÃ©. Reduce by one-third and finish with an egg yolk and cream liaison. Strain through a fine chinois. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Normandy Sauce.name: Normandy Sauce

Mirepoix.directions: A mirepoix is a mixture of onions, carrots and celery added to a stock to enhance its flavor and aroma. Although chefs differ on the ratio of vegetables, generally a mixture of 50 percent onions, 25 percent carrots and 25 percent celery, by weight, is used. (Unless otherwise noted, any reference to mirepoix in this book refers to this ratio.) For a brown stock, onion skins may be used to add color. It is not necessary to peel the carrots or celery because flavor, not aesthetics, is important. The size into which the mirepoix is chopped is determined by the stockâ€™s cooking time: The shorter the cooking time, the smaller the vegetables must be chopped to ensure that all possible flavor is extracted. For white or brown stocks made from beef or veal bones, the vegetables should be coarsely chopped into large, 1- to 2-inch (2.5- to 5-centimeter) pieces. For chicken and fish stocks, the vegetables should be more finely chopped into 1â„2-inch (1.2-centimeter) pieces.
Mirepoix.name: Mirepoix

Minestrone.directions: Soak the beans in cold water overnight, then drain. Cover the beans with water and simmer until tender, about 40 minutes. Reserve the beans. SautÃ© the onions in the oil. Add the garlic, celery and carrots and cook for 3 minutes. Add the zucchini, green beans and cabbage, one type at a time, cooking each briefly. Add the stock, tomato concassÃ©e and tomato paste. Cover and simmer for 21â„2 to 3 hours. Stir in the chopped herbs and season to taste with salt and pepper. Add the drained beans and cooked macaroni. Bring the soup to a simmer and simmer for 15 minutes. Serve in warm bowls, garnished with Parmesan.
Minestrone.name: Minestrone

Risotto Cakes.directions: 1 Heat 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) oil in a deep sautÃ© pan. Add the garlic, onion and   teaspoon (3 milliliters) each of salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat until the onion is translucent. 2 Add the rice and sautÃ© for 1 to 2 minutes, being careful not to burn the rice. 3 Reduce the heat to medium-low and add   cup (120 milliliters) stock. Cook for approximately 15 minutes, stirring frequently and adding the remaining stock slowly as needed. If additional liquid is needed for the rice to be fully cooked and tender, add hot water. 4 Add the Parmesan and season with salt and pepper. 5 Press the risotto into an even layer on a lightly greased baking sheet. Cool completely in the refrigerator. 6 Cut out six cakes, using a cookie cutter or knife. Bread the cakes with seasoned flour, egg wash and panko, using the standard breading procedure described in Chapter 9, Mise en Place. 7 Heat the remaining soybean oil in a deep sautÃ© pan to 340Â°F (171Â°C). Cook the cakes on both sides until golden brown.
Risotto Cakes.name: Risotto Cakes

Figs with Berries and Honey Mousse.directions: Pick through the berries, rinse them and drain them in a colander. Rinse the figs and cut them in half, leaving the stem attached. To make the mousse, whisk the honey, yolks and salt together in a bowl over a pan of barely simmering water. Whisk the mixture continuously for 8 minutes. After 5 minutes, the mousse will begin to thicken and the texture will become creamy. Whisk vigorously until the mousse leaves thick ribbons on its surface when poured over itself. Set aside to cool. The texture of the cooled mousse will be stiff and sticky. Whisk 1 fluid ounce (30 milliliters) cream into the mousse, working it until it loosens. Whip the remaining cream until it is firm, fold it into the mousse until it is just incorporated, then whisk the two together. The texture will be light and creamy. Loosely arrange the figs on a platter, sprinkle with the berries, garnish with mint and serve with the mousse.
Figs with Berries and Honey Mousse.name: Figs with Berries and Honey Mousse

Balsamic Mustard Vinaigrette.directions: 1 In a stainless steel bowl, whisk together the vinegar, mustard, shallots, salt and pepper. 2 Combine the oils. Slowly whisk them into the vinegar-and-mustard mixture to form an emul-sified dressing.
Balsamic Mustard Vinaigrette.name: Balsamic Mustard Vinaigrette

Eggs Benedict.directions: Toast the English muffin. SautÃ© or griddle the bacon slices until hot. Bring 1 quart (1 liter) water to a boil and add the salt and vinegar. Reduce the heat to a strong simmer. Add the eggs and poach until done. Place the muffins on a plate and top with the bacon slices. Place an egg on each slice of ba-con and cover with the Hollandaise. Garnish each egg with a truffle slice or black olive half and serve. VARIATIONS: Poached Eggs Florentineâ€”Serve poached eggs on an English muffin or pastry shell over creamed spinach with hollandaise or bÃ©chamel sauce. Poached Eggs Norwegian Styleâ€”Serve poached eggs on an English muffin with smoked salmon and hollandaise sauce. Poached Eggs Princess Styleâ€”Serve poached eggs on an English muffin with asparagus tips and hollandaise sauce. Poached Eggs Sardouâ€”Serve poached eggs and creamed spinach on an artichoke bottom with hollandaise sauce.
Eggs Benedict.name: Eggs Benedict

Creole Spice Mix.directions: 1 Combine all of the ingredients for the Creole spice mix and stir together.
Creole Spice Mix.name: Creole Spice Mix

Poivrade Sauce.directions: Sweat 12 ounces (360 grams) mirepoix in 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) oil. Add 1 bay leaf, 1 sprig thyme and 4 parsley stems. Then add 16 fluid ounces (480 milliliters) vinegar and 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) white wine. Reduce by half, add demi-glace and simmer for 40 minutes. Then add 20 crushed peppercorns and simmer for 5 more minutes. Strain through a fine chinois and finish with up to 2 ounces (60 grams) whole butter. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Poivrade Sauce.name: Poivrade Sauce

Apricot Sauce.directions: Combine all ingredients and heat until the preserves melt and the flavors blend.
Apricot Sauce.name: Apricot Sauce

Bouquet Garni.directions: Wash all items. Split carrot and separate leek leaves. Using butcher twine - tie everything into bundle.
Bouquet Garni.name: Bouquet Garni

Mopping Sauce.directions: 1 Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Mopping Sauce.name: Mopping Sauce

Crumb Pie Crust.directions: 1 Combine the crushed graham crackers, sugar and cinnamon in a mixing bowl. 2 Drizzle in the melted butter, stirring until the crumbs are evenly moistened. 3 Press the crumb mixture evenly in the bottom of a 9" pie pan. 4 Bake the shells at 350Â°F (190Â°C) until the crumbs have toasted slightly and the crust has firmed, approximately 10 to 12 minutes. Fill the parbaked shells as desired.
Crumb Pie Crust.name: Crumb Pie Crust

Montpelier Butter.directions: Blanch 1 ounce (30 grams) fresh parsley, 1 ounce (30 grams) fresh chervil, 1 ounce (30 grams) watercress and 1 ounce (30 grams) fresh tarragon in boiling water. Drain thoroughly. Mince 2 hard-boiled egg yolks, 2 garlic cloves and 2 sour gherkin pickles. Blend everything into the butter.
Montpelier Butter.name: Montpelier Butter

Thai Noodle Salad.directions: 1 Pour boiling water over the noodles and allow them to steep until they are al dente, approxi-mately 5 minutes. Refresh in cold water. Drain well. 2 Toss the noodles with the other ingredients. Adjust the seasonings to taste.
Thai Noodle Salad.name: Thai Noodle Salad

Simple Syrup.directions: Combine ingredients in heavy-bottomed stainless saucepan. Boil for 1 minute. This concentration would measure 28Â°â€“30Â° on the BaumÃ© scale, and the solution should be at 220Â°F (104Â°C). Store in clean container in refrigerator.
Simple Syrup.name: Simple Syrup

Veal Scallops (3 oz).directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board,  trim veal top round of all sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into 3 oz. scallops. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Veal Scallops (3 oz).name: Veal Scallops (3 oz)

Baked Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Br\u00c3\u00bbl\u.directions: Heat the cream and the vanilla bean in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat until bub-bles appear along the sides of the pan. Quickly whisk the sugar into the egg yolks. When the cream is hot, slowly pour it into the yolk mixture. Whisk until well combined. Strain the mixture through a fine sieve into a pitcher or large measuring cup. Scrape the va-nilla bean with the tip of a paring knife to remove the remaining seeds; stir the seeds into the custard. Preheat the oven to 325Â°F (160Â°C). Arrange the ramekins in a 2-inch- (5-centimeter-) deep hotel pan or baking dish. Pour the custard into the ramekins. Set the pan of ramekins inside the preheated oven, then carefully pour enough water into the pan to come two-thirds of the way up the sides of the ramekins. Bake until just set, approximately 45 to 50 minutes. Start checking the custards early; baking time will depend on the thickness and depth of your ramekins. The custard should be set, not soupy, with only a small area of jiggle in the center. When the custards are done, carefully remove the baking dish from the oven and allow the ramekins to cool in the water bath. When the ramekins are cool enough to handle, remove them from the water, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or up to 2 days before service. At service, sprinkle the top of each custard with granulated sugar, then immediately caramel-ize the sugar with a propane torch or under a broiler.
Baked Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Br\u00c3\u00bbl\u.name: Baked CrÃ¨me BrÃ»lÃ©e

Nantua Sauce.directions: Add to bÃ©chamel 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) heavy cream and 6 ounces (180 grams) crayfish butter (page 212). Add paprika to achieve the desired color. Garnish the finished sauce with diced crayfish meat.
Nantua Sauce.name: Nantua Sauce

White Sandwich Bread.directions: Combine the water, milk powder, sugar, salt, yeast and 12 ounces (340 grams) flour. Blend well. Add the butter and eggs and beat for 2 minutes. Stir in the remaining flour, 2 ounces (60 grams) at a time. Knead until the dough is smooth and elastic, approximately 8 minutes. Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl, cover and let it ferment at room temperature until doubled, approximately 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Shape into loaves, pan and proof until doubled. Bake at 400Â°F (200Â°C) if free-form or small loaves; bake at 375Â°F (190Â°C) if larger loaves. Bake until brown and hollow sounding, approximately 35 minutes for small loaves and 50 minutes for large loaves.
White Sandwich Bread.name: White Sandwich Bread

Chicken Stock.directions: Cut the washed bones into pieces approximately 3â€“4 inches (8â€“10 centimeters) long. Place the bones in a stockpot and cover them with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.
Chicken Stock.name: Chicken Stock

Entrec\u00c3\u00b4tes Bordelaise.directions: Slice the marrow into rounds and poach in salted water for 3 minutes. Drain the marrow and set it aside. Season the steaks and sautÃ© them in the clarified butter to the desired doneness. Finish in the oven if desired. Remove to a platter and hold in a warm place. SautÃ© the shallots in the same pan. Deglaze the pan with the wine and reduce by half. Add the demi-glace; simmer for 5 minutes. MontÃ© au beurre. Add the marrow to the sauce. Adjust the seasonings. Divide each steak into two portions and serve the steaks with the sauce.
Entrec\u00c3\u00b4tes Bordelaise.name: EntrecÃ´tes Bordelaise

Glace de Poisson.directions: Simmer the stock over very low heat. Be careful not to let it burn, and skim it often. As it reduces and the volume decreases, transfer the liquid into progressively smaller sauce-pans. Strain the liquid each time it is transferred into a smaller saucepan. Strain it a final time, cool and refrigerate. A properly made glaze will keep for several months under refrigeration.
Glace de Poisson.name: Glace de Poisson

Achiote Paste.directions: 1 Toast the ancho chiles in a skillet over medium heat for 2 minutes, or until they release some oil and have a toasted aroma. Let cool slightly, then core, seed and tear into strips. 2 Place the ancho strips in a blender with the remaining ingredients and purÃ©e until smooth.
Achiote Paste.name: Achiote Paste

French Bread Croutons.directions: Using serrated bread knife, cut bread into 1/4" thick slices. Spread on sheet pan and toast until very light golden brown.
French Bread Croutons.name: French Bread Croutons

Eggplant and Sun-Dried Tomato Pizza.directions: Slice the eggplants diagonally into 1/2-inch (1.2-centimeter) slices. Toss the eggplants with 1 fluid ounce (30 grams) olive oil and the garlic; season with salt and pepper. Place the eggplant slices on a baking sheet and roast at 375Â°F (190Â°C) until soft in the center, approximately 15 to 20 minutes. Cool and slice into strips. Preheat the oven to 500Â°F (260Â°C). Roll out the dough and place it on a lightly oiled pizza pan or well-floured wooden peel; brush it lightly with the remaining oil. Lay the eggplant and sun-dried tomatoes on top. Toss the Provolone and mozzarella together and sprinkle on the pizza. Bake the pizza until the crust is golden and crisp, approximately 8 to 12 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the Parmesan and basil.
Eggplant and Sun-Dried Tomato Pizza.name: Eggplant and Sun-Dried Tomato Pizza

Pork Stock.directions: Cut the washed bones into pieces approximately 3â€“4 inches (8â€“10 centimeters) long. Place the bones in a stockpot and cover them with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.
Pork Stock.name: Pork Stock

Beef Broth.directions: Brown the meat in 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) oil, then place it in a stockpot. Add the stock or water and bring to a simmer. Simmer gently for 2 hours, skimming the surface as necessary. After the meat has simmered for 2 hours, caramelize the mirepoix in the remaining oil and add it to the liquid. Add the turnips, leeks, tomatoes and sachet. Simmer until full flavor has developed, approximately 1 hour. Skim the surface as necessary. Carefully strain the broth through cheesecloth and season to taste. Cool and refrigerate.
Beef Broth.name: Beef Broth

Lamb Stock.directions: Place the bones in a roasting pan, one layer deep, and brown in a 375Â°F (190Â°C) oven. Turn the bones occasionally to brown them evenly. Remove the bones and place them in a stockpot. Pour off the fat from the roasting pan and reserve it. Deglaze the roasting pan with part of the cold water. Add the deglazing liquor and the rest of the cold water to the bones, covering them completely. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Add a portion of the reserved fat to the roasting pan and sautÃ© the mirepoix until evenly browned. Then add it to the simmering stock. Add the tomato paste and sachet to the stock and continue to simmer for 6 to 8 hours, skim-ming as necessary. Strain, cool and refrigerate.
Lamb Stock.name: Lamb Stock

Apple Gel\u00c3\u00a9e.directions: Add the star anise to the apple juice. Bring the juice to a boil and reduce by half. Season with salt. Cut the apple brunoise and toss with the lemon juice. Soak the gelatin sheets in cold water for approximately 5 minutes. Squeeze out the water and dissolve them in the hot apple juice. Pour the mixture into a shallow pan. Cool over an ice bath. When the mixture begins to set, stir in the brunoise apple so that the apple pieces become suspended in the gelÃ©e and are evenly dispersed. Refrigerate until firm.
Apple Gel\u00c3\u00a9e.name: Apple GelÃ©e

Morning Glory Muffins.directions: Sift the dry ingredients together and set aside. Combine the carrots, raisins, pecans, coconut and apple. Whisk together the eggs, oil and vanilla extract. Toss the carrot mixture into the dry ingredients. Then add the liquid ingredients, stirring just until combined.
Morning Glory Muffins.name: Morning Glory Muffins

Parsnip Pur\u00c3\u00a9e.directions: Peel the parsnips and potatoes and cut into large pieces of approximately the same size. Boil the vegetables separately in salted water until tender. Drain the vegetables well. PurÃ©e them together through a food mill. Add the cream and butter and mix to combine. Adjust the consistency by adding cream as desired. Season the mixture with salt and white pepper and serve hot. VARIATIONS: Turnip PurÃ©eâ€”Substitute turnips for the parsnips. Winter Squash PurÃ©eâ€”Select approximately 6 1/2 pounds (3 kilograms) winter squash (such as acorn, butternut, pumpkin) and cut them in halves or quarters. Scoop out the seeds and then roast the squash, cut side down, in a 375Â°F (190Â°C) oven until tender. Scoop the flesh from the shells and substitute it for the parsnips.
Parsnip Pur\u00c3\u00a9e.name: Parsnip PurÃ©e

Orange Rind.directions: Wash orange.                                                                                      2) Peel orange rind, avoiding white pith.                                         3) Dice or julienne with sharp knife
Orange Rind.name: Orange Rind

Garlic Tuiles.directions: 1 Cream the butter, sugar and salt together. Add the egg whites one at a time while mixing until they are all incorporated. 2 Add the flour, garlic purÃ©e, Parmesan and parsley to the mixture and mix until smooth. Re-frigerate for 1 hour before using. 3 Using approximately   ounces (45 grams) of batter, form a rectangular strip approximately 6 inches (15 centimeters) long and   inches (3.5 centimeters) wide on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat. A pastry bag fitted with an appropriate tip works well for this purpose. Repeat placing up to 6 strips on the sheet. 4 Bake the batter at 350ÂºF (180ÂºC) for 5 to 7 minutes or until the strips of batter are nicely browned on the edges and pale in the center. 5 Working quickly before the tuiles cool, remove them from the pan using a spatula and wrap them around a large rolling pin to form rings. 6 When cool the tuiles will be crisp. Hold in a dry area until needed for service. 7 For service, toss the romaine leaves in dressing and carefully arrange them in the tuile rings on chilled serving plates.
Garlic Tuiles.name: Garlic Tuiles

Soubise Sauce.directions: Sweat 1 pound (480 grams) diced onions in 1 ounce (30 grams) whole butter without browning. Add bÃ©chamel and simmer until the onions are fully cooked. Strain through a fine chinois.
Soubise Sauce.name: Soubise Sauce

Sugar Syrup (medium).directions: Combine ingredients in heavy-bottomed stainless saucepan. Boil for 1 minute. This concentration would measure 21Â°â€“24Â° on the BaumÃ© scale. Store in clean container in refrigerator.
Sugar Syrup (medium).name: Sugar Syrup (medium)

Duck Confit.directions: Rub the duck with the salt. Place it skin side down in a roasting pan just large enough to hold the pieces in one layer; season with the pepper, bay leaves, thyme and garlic. Cover and re-frigerate overnight. Dry the duck with clean paper towels. Place it, skin side up, in a clean roasting pan, just large enough to hold the pieces in one layer. Bake the duck at 325Â°F (160Â°C) until brown, approx-imately 15 to 20 minutes. Add enough melted duck or goose fat to cover the pieces completely. Cover the pan and cook in a 300Â°F (150Â°C) oven until the duck is very tender, approximately 2 hours. Remove the duck from the fat and place in a deep hotel pan. Ladle enough of the cooking fat over the pieces to cover them completely. Be careful not to add any of the cooking juices. Cover the pan and refrigerate for 2 days to allow the flavors to mellow. To serve, remove the duck from the fat and scrape off the excess fat. Bake at 350Â°F (180Â°C) until the skin is crisp and the meat is hot, approximately 30 minutes.
Duck Confit.name: Duck Confit

Allemande Sauce.directions: Bring the veloutÃ© to a simmer. In a stainless steel bowl, whip the egg yolks with the cream to create a liaison. Ladle approx-imately one-third of the hot veloutÃ© sauce into this mixture, while whisking, to temper the yolk-and-cream mixture. When one-third of the veloutÃ© has been incorporated into the now-warmed yolk-and-cream mixture, gradually add the liaison to the remaining veloutÃ© sauce while whisking continuous-ly. Reheat the sauce. Do not let it boil. Add the lemon juice; season with salt and white pepper to taste. Strain through a china cap lined with cheesecloth.
Allemande Sauce.name: Allemande Sauce

Brioche Dough.directions: Place the flour, eggs, salt and sugar into the bowl of a mixer fitted with a dough hook. Stir the ingredients together. Combine the yeast and water and add to the other ingredients. Knead approximately 20 minutes on medium speed. The dough will be smooth, shiny and moist. It should not form a ball. Slowly add the butter to the dough. Knead only until all the butter is incorporated. Remove the dough from the mixer and place it into a bowl dusted with flour. Cover and let the dough ferment at room temperature until doubled. Punch down the dough, cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Portion and shape the chilled dough as desired.
Brioche Dough.name: Brioche Dough

Redfish Sopa Base.directions: 1 Cut the corn kernels from the cobs. Reserve the corn and the cobs. 2 Heat the oil in a small stockpot. Add the garlic, onions, bell peppers, poblanos and celery. Cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly caramelized, approximately 8 to 10 minutes. 3 Add the stock, corn cobs and bouquet garni. Bring to a boil and reduce by half. Remove and discard the corn cobs. 4 Make a slurry with the masa harina and water. Add to the stock while whisking to prevent lumps. Stir in the chilli powder and cumin. 5 Add the serrano chiles, corn kernels, salt and pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes, remove from the heat and purÃ©e the base in a blender. Chill and reserve.
Redfish Sopa Base.name: Redfish Sopa Base

Plum Tomato Concass\u00c3\u00a9.directions: With a paring knife, mark an x on the bottom of the tomato just deep enough to penetrate the skin. Blanch the tomato in boiling water for 20 seconds,refresh in ice water. Using a paring knife, cut out the core and peel the tomato. Cut the tomato in half horizontally and squeeze out the seeds and juice. Chop or dice the tomato as desired for the recipe.
Plum Tomato Concass\u00c3\u00a9.name: Plum Tomato ConcassÃ©

Gingered Dal.directions: 1 Bring the lentils, water, potatoes, ginger and salt to a boil. Cover and simmer until the lentils are tender and the water is absorbed, approximately 1 hour. 2 In a large sautÃ© pan, melt the butter and add the onion and the cumin and mustard seeds. Cook until the butter is slightly brown. Transfer to a large mixing bowl. Add the lentil mix-ture and mash with a wooden spoon. Season with salt and pepper and add the lemon juice. Hold warm for service.
Gingered Dal.name: Gingered Dal

Spanish Romesco Sauce.directions: Roast the bell peppers over the open flame of a gas burner. Peel them, remove the seeds and chop them coarsely. Toast the almonds and hazelnuts in a dry sautÃ© pan. Cool them and grind them in the bowl of a food processor until they are almost a paste. Add the bell peppers, garlic, Italian parsley, paprika and chilli powder to the bowl of the pro-cessor and pulse to combine the ingredients. Add the vinegar and purÃ©e to a smooth paste. With the processor running, add the oil in a slow stream to emulsify the sauce. Season to taste.
Spanish Romesco Sauce.name: Spanish Romesco Sauce

Cheese Sauce.directions: Add to bÃ©chamel 8 ounces (240 grams) grated Cheddar or American cheese, a dash of Worcestershire sauce and 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) dry mustard.
Cheese Sauce.name: Cheese Sauce

Vegetable Stock.directions: Heat the oil. Add the mirepoix, leek, garlic, fennel, turnip and tomato and sweat for 10 minutes. Add the wine, water and sachet. Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook for 45 minutes. Strain, cool and refrigerate.
Vegetable Stock.name: Vegetable Stock

Veal Scallops (6 oz).directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim veal of all sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into 6 oz. scallops. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Veal Scallops (6 oz).name: Veal Scallops (6 oz)

Red Pepper Butter.directions: PurÃ©e 8 ounces (240 grams) roasted, peeled red bell peppers until liquid, then add to the butter.
Red Pepper Butter.name: Red Pepper Butter

Classic Rice Pilaf.directions: Heat the butter and oil in a heavy sautoir or saucepot. Add the onion and bay leaf and sautÃ© until the onion is tender, but not brown. Add the rice and stir to coat it completely with the hot fat. Do not allow the rice to brown. Pour in the boiling stock and season with salt. Cover the pot tightly and place it in a 350Â°F (180Â°C) oven. Bake until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is fluffy and tender, approximately 18 to 20 minutes. Transfer the cooked rice to a hotel pan and fluff the rice with a fork. Remove the bay leaf and keep the rice hot for service. VARIATION: Spanish Riceâ€”Substitute 2 ounces (60 grams) bacon fat for the butter. Add three chopped garlic cloves and 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) pure ground chilli powder with the diced onion. In Step 3, sautÃ© the rice until it browns slightly. In place of the chicken stock, use half chicken stock and half chopped canned tomatoes with juice. Add 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) chopped cilantro when adding the liquids
Classic Rice Pilaf.name: Classic Rice Pilaf

Brennan's Red-Wine and Mushroom Sauce.directions: 1 Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Add the onion and sautÃ© until tender, approximately 3 minutes. 2 Stir in the tomato paste, mushrooms and paprika. Cook until the mushroom is tender, then add the flour. Stir until well blended. 3 Using a whisk, incorporate the stock. When the sauce is smooth, add the green onions, Worcestershire sauce, wine and garlic. Simmer until reduced and thickened, approximately 25 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper and hold for service
Brennan's Red-Wine and Mushroom Sauce.name: Brennan's Red-Wine and Mushroom Sauce

Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Chantilly (Chantilly Cr.directions: Place the cream in a chilled mixing bowl. Using a balloon whisk, whisk the cream until slightly thickened. Add the sugar and vanilla and continue whisking to the desired consistency. The cream should be smooth and light, not grainy. Do not overwhip. CrÃ¨me Chantilly may be stored in the refrigerator for several hours. If the cream begins to soften, gently rewhip as necessary. VARIATION: Chocolate Chantillyâ€”Melt 1 pound 2 ounces (540 grams) bittersweet chocolate to 120Â°F (49Â°C) and remove from heat. Whip the cream to medium peaks. Whisk one-fourth of the whipped cream into the chocolate vigorously. Gently fold in the remaining cream. This mixture will have the texture of velvety ganache.
Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Chantilly (Chantilly Cr.name: CrÃ¨me Chantilly (Chantilly Cream)

Smoked Bacon and Black Quinoa Pilaf.directions: 1 Dice the bacon and cook in a medium saucepan until crisp. Remove the bacon and reserve. 2 Add the onion, carrot and bell peppers to the bacon grease and sautÃ© for 2 minutes. Add the rice and quinoa and sautÃ© until the rice becomes translucent and is completely coated with the bacon grease.
Smoked Bacon and Black Quinoa Pilaf.name: Smoked Bacon and Black Quinoa Pilaf

Orange Vinaigrette.directions: 1 Combine the orange juice, vinegar, salt, pepper and mustard in the bowl of a food processor or blender. Process to combine. 2 Add the oil and process for 1 minute. Remove from the processor and stir in the green on-ions.
Orange Vinaigrette.name: Orange Vinaigrette

B\u00c3\u00a9arnaise.directions: Combine 2 ounces (60 grams) chopped shallots, 5 tablespoons (75 milliliters) chopped fresh tarragon, 3 tablespoons (45 milliliters) chopped fresh chervil and 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) crushed peppercorns with 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) white wine vinegar. Reduce to 2 fluid ounces (60 milliliters). Add this reduction to the egg yolks and proceed with the hollandaise recipe. Strain the finished sauce and season to taste with salt and cayenne pepper. Garnish with additional chopped fresh tarragon.
B\u00c3\u00a9arnaise.name: BÃ©arnaise

Biscuit Dough.directions: 1. Sift the dry ingredients together, making sure they are blended thoroughly. 2. Cut in the butter. The mixture should look mealy; do not overmix. 3. Add the milk and stir, combining only until the mixture holds together. 4. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface; knead until it forms one mass, approxi-mately five or six kneadings. 5. Roll out the dough to a thickness of 1/2 inch (1.2 centimeters). Cut with a floured cutter into desired size.
Biscuit Dough.name: Biscuit Dough

Honey Cardamom Butter.directions: 1 In a sautÃ© pan, heat the butter until it begins to brown. Add the cardamom, salt and pepper. Remove from the heat and add the honey. 2 Cool the mixture at room temperature until it begins to solidify. Transfer to the bowl of a small mixer and whip until it emulsifies. Transfer to a piece of parchment paper or plastic and form into a log. Refrigerate until ready to use.
Honey Cardamom Butter.name: Honey Cardamom Butter

Coffee.directions: Using preferred coffee maker and method, brew coffee. Let cool to lukewarm and either use immediately or place in refrigerator.
Coffee.name: Coffee

Fresh Tomato Sauce for Pasta.directions: Sweat the onion, carrot and garlic in the oil until tender. Add the tomato concassÃ©e, oregano and thyme. Simmer for approximately 1 hour or until the desired consistency is reached. Pass the sauce through a food mill if a smooth consistency is desired. Do not purÃ©e if a chun-kier sauce is desired. Adjust the seasonings and add the basil.
Fresh Tomato Sauce for Pasta.name: Fresh Tomato Sauce for Pasta

Pho Bo (Hanoi Beef and Noodle Soup).directions: Place the oxtails in a stockpot and add enough water to cover them by approximately 4 inches (10 centimeters). Bring it to a boil and then reduce to a simmer, skimming the surface as necessary. Halve and char the onion for an onion brÃ»lÃ©. Split the ginger lengthwise and char its surface. Add the onion brÃ»lÃ©, charred ginger, salt, fish sauce and sachet to the stockpot. Simmer the broth for 4 to 5 hours. Remove the sachet and strain the broth through a chinois. Adjust the seasonings and maintain the broth at a simmer. Put the garnishes in bowls or trays and place them on each table. Reheat the vermicelli by dropping them into boiling water for a few seconds. Divide the reheated vermicelli noodles into six large warm bowls. Place several pieces of raw beef ten-derloin on top of each portion of vermicelli. Pour boiling hot broth over the meat into each bowl. Serve the hot broth to the diners, allowing them to garnish their portions with onions, mung beans, herbs, lime wedges, fish sauce, chiles and chile sauce as desired. (The meat will cook when stirred into the hot broth.)
Pho Bo (Hanoi Beef and Noodle Soup).name: Pho Bo (Hanoi Beef and Noodle Soup)

Simmered Rice.directions: Â Bring the water and salt to a boil in a heavy saucepan. Slowly add the rice. Â Cover the pan and reduce the heat so that the liquid simmers gently. Cook until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed, approximately 15 to 20 minutes. Â Remove from the heat and transfer to a hotel pan. Do not cover. Allow any excess moisture to evaporate for approximately 5 minutes. Â Fluff the rice and serve, or refrigerate for use in another recipe.
Simmered Rice.name: Simmered Rice

Shallot Butter.directions: Blanch 8 ounces (240 grams) peeled shallots in boiling water. Dry and finely dice them and mix with the butter.
Shallot Butter.name: Shallot Butter

Chili Con Carne.directions: SautÃ© the onions in the oil until tender. Add the garlic and sautÃ© for 1 minute. Add the beef and brown, stirring occasionally. Drain off the excess fat. Add the remaining ingredients, bring to a simmer, cover and cook for 1 to 11â„2 hours. Remove the bay leaves and adjust the seasonings.
Chili Con Carne.name: Chili Con Carne

New England-Style Clam Chowder.directions: Drain the clams, reserving both the clams and their liquid. Add enough water or stock so that the total liquid equals 2 quarts (1.9 liters). Simmer the potatoes in the clam liquid until nearly cooked through. Strain and reserve the potatoes and the liquid. Render the salt pork with the butter. Add the onions and celery to the rendered fat and sweat until tender but not brown. Add the flour and cook to make a blond roux. Add the clam liquid to the roux, whisking away any lumps. Simmer for 30 minutes, skimming as necessary. Bring the milk and cream to a boil and add to the soup. Add the clams and potatoes, and season to taste with salt, pepper, Tabasco sauce, Worcester-shire sauce and thyme. Garnish each serving with fresh parsley and julienned carrot as desired. Note: If using fresh clams for the chowder, wash and steam approximately 1â„2 bushel (15 liters) chowder clams in a small amount of water to yield 11â„4 quarts (1.4 liters) clam meat. Chop the clams. Strain the liquid through several layers of cheesecloth to remove any sand that may be present. Add enough water or stock so that the total liquid is 2 quarts (1.9 liters). Continue with the recipe, starting at step 2.
New England-Style Clam Chowder.name: New England-Style Clam Chowder

Dark Chocolate Syrup.directions: Mix the cocoa powder with just enough of the water to make a smooth paste. Bring the sugar and remaining water to a boil in a small, heavy saucepan. Immediately add the cocoa paste, whisking until smooth. Simmer for 15 minutes, stirring constantly, then remove from the heat. Stir the butter and cream into the warm cocoa mixture. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Dark Chocolate Syrup.name: Dark Chocolate Syrup

Red-Wine Thyme Sauce.directions: 1 SautÃ© the shallot lightly in the clarified butter until slightly caramelized. 2 Add the wine, thyme and bay leaf and reduce by one-third. 3 Squeeze in the garlic, discarding the skins and root. 4 Add the demi-glace and reduce by one-third. 5 Thicken slightly with roux if desired, adjust the seasonings and force through a fine strainer.
Red-Wine Thyme Sauce.name: Red-Wine Thyme Sauce

Popovers.directions: Place twenty 4-ounce (120-milliliter) greased ramekins or popover tins on a sheet pan and drop 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) of beef fat or vegetable oil in the bottom of each ramekin. Place the ramekins in a 425Â°F (220Â°C) oven until the fat smokes. Sift the flour and salt together into a large bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk and butter. Pour the liquid ingredients into the dry ingredients and whip until smooth. Remove the ramekins from the oven and fill each approximately two-thirds full with batter. Bake at 425Â°F (220Â°C) for 20 minutes without opening the oven door. After 20 minutes, lower the heat to 375Â°F (190Â°C) and bake until the popovers dry out inside, approximately 10 more minutes. Remove the popovers from the oven, unmold and serve. For crisper popovers, slit the sides of the unmolded popovers to allow the steam to escape. Place on a sheet pan and return them to the oven until the tops are firm, crisp and brown, ap-proximately 10 minutes.
Popovers.name: Popovers

Dirty Rice.directions: 1 Heat the oil in a heavy-bottomed saucepan until smoking. Add the livers and the pork or beef and sautÃ© until well browned. 2 Add the onion, garlic and spices and continue to cook and brown the mixture. Deglaze with a little stock and continue to cook until all the ingredients are well browned. 3 Add the remaining stock, the rice, green onions and parsley. Stir and cook until the rice is hot and then serve.
Dirty Rice.name: Dirty Rice

Grimrod Sauce.directions: Infuse a hollandaise sauce with saffron.
Grimrod Sauce.name: Grimrod Sauce

Pastry Cream (Cr\u00c3\u00a8me P\u00c3\u.directions: Boil the milk and 3 ounces (120 grams) sugar in a large nonreactive saucepan. Whisk the egg yolks in a mixing bowl and gradually add the remaining sugar. Whisk in the cornstarch to combine. Temper the egg yolk mixture with one-quarter of the boiling milk. Return the egg mixture to the pan and cook, whisking vigorously until the cream boils and is well thickened. Allow the pastry cream to boil approximately 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove the pastry cream from the heat and immediately pour it into a clean mixing bowl. Fold in the butter until melted. Do not overmix, as this will thin the custard. Cover by placing plastic wrap on the surface of the custard. Chill over an ice bath. Remove the vanilla bean just before using the pastry cream. VARIATIONS: Chocolate Pastry Creamâ€”Stir 4 ounces (120 grams) finely chopped dark chocolate into the strained custard while it is still warm. The heat of the custard will melt the chocolate. Coffee Pastry Creamâ€”Add 1 fluid ounce (30 milliliters) coffee extract or compound to the warm custard. Mousseline Pastry Creamâ€”Whip 12 fluid ounces (360 milliliters) heavy cream to stiff peaks. Fold into the chilled Pastry Cream Filling.
Pastry Cream (Cr\u00c3\u00a8me P\u00c3\u.name: Pastry Cream (CrÃ¨me PÃ¢tissiÃ¨re)

Mushroom Sauce.directions: Blanch 8 ounces (240 grams) mushroom caps in 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) boiling water seasoned with salt and lemon juice. Drain the mushrooms, saving the liquid. Reduce this liquid to 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) and add it to the demi-glace. Just before service stir in 2 ounces (60 grams) whole butter and the mushroom caps. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Mushroom Sauce.name: Mushroom Sauce

Aurora Sauce.directions: Add to allemande 2 ounces (60 grams) tomato paste and finish with 1 ounce (30 grams) butter. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Aurora Sauce.name: Aurora Sauce

Balsamic Honey Glaze.directions: 1 Combine all ingredients in a small saucepot. Simmer and reduce until it reachs a syruplike consistency.
Balsamic Honey Glaze.name: Balsamic Honey Glaze

Black Bean Spread.directions: Combine the beans and the water, bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook until tender, approximately 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 10 minutes. Drain the beans, reserving the cooking liquid. Chill the beans and the liquid. PurÃ©e the beans in a food processor, adding enough of the cooking liquid to make a soft, spreadable purÃ©e.
Black Bean Spread.name: Black Bean Spread

Duchesse Potatoes.directions: Peel and quarter the potatoes. Then boil them in salted water until tender. Drain and immediately turn them out onto a sheet pan to allow the moisture to evaporate. While still warm, press the potatoes through a grinder or food mill, or grind through a grinderâ€™s medium die. Blend in the butter and season to taste with nutmeg, salt and pepper. Mix in the eggs and egg yolks, blending well. Transfer the duchesse mixture to a piping bag fitted with a large star tip. Pipe single portion-sized spirals onto a parchment-lined sheet pan. Brush with clarified butter and bake at 375Â°F (190Â°C) until the edges are golden brown, approximately 8 to 10 minutes. Serve immedi-ately. Note: Duchesse potatoes are often used to decorate platters used for buffets or tableside prepara-tions or to present chÃ¢teaubriand. To create borders and garnishes, the standard mixture for duchesse potatoes is forced through a piping bag while still very hot and relatively soft. VARIATION: Potato Croquettesâ€”Shape the duchesse mixture into short cylinders resembling fat corks. Coat the cylinders with bread crumbs using the standard breading procedure described in Chapter 8, Mise en Place. Using the basket method, deep-fry at 360Â°F (182Â°C) until golden brown.
Duchesse Potatoes.name: Duchesse Potatoes

Velout\u00c3\u00a9.directions: Heat the butter in a heavy saucepan. Add the flour and cook to make a blond roux. Gradually add the stock to the roux, stirring constantly with a whisk to prevent lumps. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. (Seasonings are optional; their use depends on the season-ings in the stock and the sauceâ€™s intended use.) Simmer and reduce to 1 gallon (3.8 liters), approximately 30 minutes. Strain through a china cap lined with cheesecloth. Melted butter may be carefully ladled over the surface of the sauce to prevent a skin from forming. Hold for service or cool in a water bath.
Velout\u00c3\u00a9.name: VeloutÃ©

Potato and Celeriac Pur\u00c3\u00a9e.directions: Combine the potatoes and celeriac in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat, and simmer until tender, approximately 30 minutes. 2 Strain. Mash the potatoes and celeriac using a food mill or potato ricer. 3 Heat the cream and butter just to a boil. Add to the hot potato mixture. Using an electric mix-er fitted with a whip attachment, whip the purÃ©e until fluffy. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Potato and Celeriac Pur\u00c3\u00a9e.name: Potato and Celeriac PurÃ©e

Gazpacho.directions: Combine and purÃ©e all ingredients except the tomato juice, stock and garnish in a VCM, food processor or blender. Stir in the tomato juice. Adjust the consistency with the stock. Stir in the vegetable garnishes and adjust the seasonings. Serve in chilled cups or bowls garnished with fresh basil. VARIATION: Gazpacho can be made without purÃ©eing all the ingredients. Less garnish will be required
Gazpacho.name: Gazpacho

Posole.directions: Trim the fat from the pork shoulder and cut the meat into medium dice. Place the meat in a heavy saucepot with the stock. Add more stock if necessary to just cover the meat. Bring to a simmer. Skim the scum from the surface. Drain the hominy and soak it in cold water until needed. After the pork has simmered for 2 minutes, add one-third of the onions, half of the garlic, and the oregano, salt, black pepper and cayenne pepper. Simmer for 1 hour. Bone and skin the chicken. Cut the meat into medium dice and refrigerate until needed. Sweat the remaining two-thirds of the onions in a sautÃ© pan in a little oil until soft. Add the remaining garlic and cook an additional 2 minutes. Add the raw chicken and cook until it loses its raw look. Mix in the chilli powder, tomatoes, Anaheim chiles and drained hominy. Cook until the flavors have blended. Add the mixture to the pork in the saucepot. Simmer until the chicken is cooked. Add the cilantro. Adjust the consistency of the posole with chicken stock, if necessary. For service, cut the limes into wedges. Cut the tortillas in half, then cut them crosswise into thin strips and fry them in hot oil until crisp. Toss the romaine lettuce with the cider vinegar. Garnish each bowl with romaine lettuce, diced onions, fried tortilla strips and a lime wedge.
Posole.name: Posole

Lemon Pesto.directions: 1 Zest the lemons. Combine the zest, garlic, basil, parsley and salt in a food processor fitted with a metal blade. Process until minced. 2 With the motor running, drizzle in the oil to form a sauce.
Lemon Pesto.name: Lemon Pesto

Celery Juice.directions: Cut celery into large chunks. Place in heavy duty Acme juicer. Collect and store juice in clean container.
Celery Juice.name: Celery Juice

Pineapple Papaya Salsa.directions: Core and dice the tomatoes. Peel and dice the pineapple. Peel, seed and dice the papaya. Combine all the ingredients and chill well.
Pineapple Papaya Salsa.name: Pineapple Papaya Salsa

Shallot Curry Oil.directions: In a small saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) oil over medium heat. Add the shallot and sautÃ© until softened and translucent. Do not allow the shallot to brown. Add the curry powder and sautÃ© for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the water and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until most of the water evaporates, leaving a paste of curry and shallots. Remove from the heat and stir in the remaining oil. Place the mixture in a lidded jar and set aside at room temperature for 6 to 8 hours. Shake the jar occasionally. Strain the oil through a chinois lined with a coffee filter. Place the flavored oil in a covered container and refrigerate until ready to use.
Shallot Curry Oil.name: Shallot Curry Oil

Fish Stock.directions: Sweat mirepoix and mushroom trimmings in butter until tender for 1 to 2 minutes. Combine all ingredients except the sachet in a stockpot. Bring to a simmer and skim impurities as necessary. Add the sachet and simmer uncovered for 30 to 45 minutes. Strain, cool and refrigerate.
Fish Stock.name: Fish Stock

Smoked Corn Pudding.directions: 1 Coat an 8-inch- (20-centimeter-) square pan with 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) butter. 2 In a medium saucepan, bring the milk to a boil. Lower the heat and gradually whisk in the cornmeal. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes, stirring with a wooden spoon. 3 Add the salt, pepper, corn, onion and remaining butter; cook for an additional 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the egg yolks one at a time, beating well with a wooden spoon after each addition. 4 Add a pinch of salt to the egg whites and beat with a fine whisk until stiff. Fold the whipped egg whites into the cornmeal mixture, one half at a time. Pour into the buttered pan and bake at 350Â°F (180Â°C) until golden brown, approximately 30 minutes.
Smoked Corn Pudding.name: Smoked Corn Pudding

Brown Veal Stock.directions: Place the bones in a roasting pan, one layer deep, and brown in a 375Â°F (190Â°C) oven. Turn the bones occasionally to brown them evenly. Remove the bones and place them in a stockpot. Pour off the fat from the roasting pan and reserve it. Deglaze the roasting pan with part of the cold water. Add the deglazing liquor and the rest of the cold water to the bones, covering them completely. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Add a portion of the reserved fat to the roasting pan and sautÃ© the mirepoix until evenly browned. Then add it to the simmering stock. Add the tomato paste and sachet to the stock and continue to simmer for 6 to 8 hours, skim-ming as necessary. Strain, cool and refrigerate.
Brown Veal Stock.name: Brown Veal Stock

Vanilla Custard Sauce (Cr\u00c3\u00a8me.directions: Using a heavy nonreactive saucepan, bring the half-and-half and vanilla bean just to a boil. Whisk the egg yolks and sugar together in a mixing bowl. Temper the egg mixture with ap-proximately one-third of the hot half-and-half, then return the entire mixture to the saucepan with the remaining half-and-half. Cook the sauce over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Do not allow the sauce to exceed 185Â°F (85Â°C) or the mixture will curdle. As soon as the sauce thickens, remove it from the heat and pour it through a fine mesh strain-er into a clean bowl. Chill the sauce in an ice bath, then cover and keep refrigerated. The sauce should last 3 to 4 days. VARIATIONS: Chocolate Custard Sauceâ€”Stir 6 ounces (180 grams) finely chopped dark chocolate into the strained custard while it is still warm. The heat of the custard will melt the chocolate. Coffee Custard Sauceâ€”Add 1â€“1 1/2 fluid ounces (30â€“45 milliliters) coffee (cafÃ©) extract or com-pound to the warm custard. Frangelico Custard Sauceâ€”Omit the vanilla bean. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon (2 milliliters) vanilla ex-tract and 2â€“3 tablespoons (30â€“45 milliliters) Frangelico, to taste. Ginger Custard Sauceâ€”Omit the vanilla bean. Steep 3 ounces (90 grams) chopped fresh ginger for 10 minutes in the half-and-half. Reheat and continue preparing the sauce as directed. The chopped ginger will be strained out in Step 4. Pistachio Custard Sauceâ€”Omit the vanilla bean. Place 4 ounces (120 grams) finely chopped pistachio nuts in the saucepan with the barely boiling half-and-half. Remove from the heat, cover and steep for up to 1 hour. Uncover the mixture, reheat and continue preparing the sauce as directed. The ground nuts will be strained out in Step 4.
Vanilla Custard Sauce (Cr\u00c3\u00a8me.name: Vanilla Custard Sauce (CrÃ¨me Anglaise)

Savory Crepes.directions: Whisk together the eggs, egg yolks, water and milk. Add the sugar, salt and flour; whisk to-gether. Stir in the melted butter. Cover and set aside to rest for at least 1 hour before cooking. Heat a small sautÃ© or crÃªpe pan; brush lightly with clarified butter. Pour in 1 to 1 1/2 fluid ounces (30 to 45 milliliters) of batter; swirl to coat the bottom of the pan evenly. Cook the crÃªpe until set and light brown, approximately 30 seconds. Flip it over and cook a few seconds longer. Remove from the pan. Repeat this process until all the batter is used. Cooked crÃªpes may be used immediately or covered and held briefly in a warm oven. CrÃªpes can also be wrapped well in plastic wrap and refrigerated for 2 to 3 days or frozen for several weeks. Note: May Substitute up to 5 ounces (150 grams) buckwheat flour or whole-wheat flour for an equal amount of the all-purpose flour.
Savory Crepes.name: Savory Crepes

Veal Cutlets (4 oz).directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim meat of all excess fat and sliverskin Using accurate scale - cut 4 oz cutlets Layout on paper-lined hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator."
Veal Cutlets (4 oz).name: Veal Cutlets (4 oz)

Beef Stroganoff.directions: SautÃ© the tenderloin tips in the butter, searing on all sides. Remove the meat and set aside. Add the onion to the pan and sautÃ© lightly. Add the mushrooms and sautÃ© until dry. Add the demi-glace. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes. Add the cream, sour cream, mustard and any meat juices that accumulated while holding the meat. Return the meat to the sauce to reheat. Stir in the dill and parsley. Adjust the seasonings and serve over hot egg noodles.
Beef Stroganoff.name: Beef Stroganoff

Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Chiboust.directions: 1 Prepare a pastry cream by heating the milk and vanilla bean just to a boil. Whisk the egg yolks, 3 tablespoons (45 milliliters) sugar and the cornstarch together. Temper with one-third of the hot milk, then return the mixture to the saucepan and cook over moderate heat until thick. Allow the pastry cream to boil briefly to properly gelatinize the starch. Remove the cream from the heat and transfer to a clean bowl. 2 Stir the softened gelatin into the hot cream. Cover and set aside, but do not chill the cream or allow it to set while preparing the Italian meringue. 3 Prepare an Italian meringue as described on page 1173 using the remaining ingredients. Whip the meringue just until the hot syrup is incorporated, approximately 1 minute.
Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Chiboust.name: CrÃ¨me Chiboust

Shrimp Bisque.directions: Caramelize the mirepoix and shrimp shells in the butter. Add the garlic and tomato paste and sautÃ© lightly. Add the brandy and flambÃ©. Add the wine. Deglaze and reduce the liquid by half. Add the veloutÃ© and sachet and simmer for approximately 1 hour, skimming occasionally. Strain, discarding the sachet and reserving the liquid and solids. PurÃ©e the solids and return them to the liquid. Return to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes. Strain the bisque through a fine chinois or china cap lined with cheesecloth. Return the bisque to a simmer and add the cream. Season to taste with salt, white pepper and cayenne pepper. Add sherry, if using. 10. Cook the shrimp and slice or dice them as desired. Garnish each portion of soup with cooked shrimp and the basil chiffonade.
Shrimp Bisque.name: Shrimp Bisque

Bread Pudding with Bourbon Sauce.directions: Combine the raisins and brandy in a small saucepan. Heat just to a simmer, cover and set aside. Use a portion of the butter to thoroughly coat a 2-inch- (5-centimeter-) deep hotel pan. Re-serve the remaining butter. Tear the bread into chunks and place in a large bowl. Pour the cream over the bread and set aside until soft. Beat the eggs and sugar until smooth and thick. Add the vanilla, the remaining melted butter and the raisins and brandy. Toss the egg mixture with the bread gently to blend. Pour into the hotel pan and bake at 350Â°F (180Â°C) until browned and almost set, approximately 45 minutes. Serve warm with 1â€“1 1/2 fluid ounces (30â€“45 milliliters) Bourbon Sauce. VARIATION: Chocolate Bread Puddingâ€”Omit the brandy, raisins and butter. Melt 6 ounces (180 grams) unsalted butter and 12 ounces (360 grams) bittersweet chocolate together. Add the chocolate and butter to the egg mixture in Step 4. Serve with Vanilla Custard Sauce (page 1050).
Bread Pudding with Bourbon Sauce.name: Bread Pudding with Bourbon Sauce

Sweet Potato Biscuits.directions: Peel the sweet potatoes and cut into large pieces. Steam until tender, mash or pass through a food mill and spread onto a parchment-lined sheet pan. Cool completely. In a mixing bowl, sift together the flours, salt and baking powder. Cut the shortening into the dry ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse meal. In a separate mixing bowl, combine the sweet potatoes, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves and allspice. Work the sweet potato mixture into the flour mixture until combined. Add 28 fluid ounces (840 milliliters) buttermilk. Mix to form a soft dough. The consistency will depend on the moisture content of the sweet potatoes. Add the remaining buttermilk if necessary. Allow the dough to rest for 5 minutes. Dust the work surface with high-gluten flour. Roll out the dough to a thickness of 1/2 inch (1.2 centimeters). Cut to the desired size with a floured cutter and place on a paper-lined sheet pan. Make an egg wash with the eggs and milk and brush the tops of the biscuits. Bake at 400Â°F (200Â°C) for 12 to 15 minutes. Combine the softened butter and the honey. Remove the biscuits from the oven when done and immediately brush with the honey butter.
Sweet Potato Biscuits.name: Sweet Potato Biscuits

Toffee Caramel Flan.directions: Combine the granulated sugar with the water in a small heavy saucepan; bring to a boil. Cook until the sugar reaches a deep golden brown. Immediately pour about 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) caramelized sugar into each ramekin. Tilt each ramekin to spread the caramel evenly along the bottom. Arrange the ramekins in a 2-inch- (5-centimeter-) deep hotel pan and set aside. Combine the milk, cream, cinnamon sticks and vanilla bean in a large saucepan. Bring just to a boil, cover and remove from the heat. Allow this mixture to steep for about 30 minutes. Whisk the eggs, egg yolks, brown sugar, molasses and amaretto together in a large bowl. Uncover the milk mixture and return it to the stove top. Bring just to a boil. Temper the egg-and-sugar mixture with approximately one-third of the hot milk. Whisk in the remaining hot milk. Strain the custard through a fine mesh strainer. Pour into the caramel-lined ramekins, filling to just below the rim. Pour enough warm water into the hotel pan to reach halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake at 325Â°F (160Â°C) for approximately 30 to 40 minutes. The custards should be almost set, but still slightly soft in the center. Completely chill the baked custards before serving.
