To unmold, run a small knife around the edge of the custard, invert onto the serving plate and give the ramekin a firm sideways shake. Garnish with fresh fruit or caramelized almonds.
Toffee Caramel Flan.name: Toffee Caramel Flan

Port Sauce.directions: Bring demi-glace to a boil and reduce slightly. Then add 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) Port wine. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Port Sauce.name: Port Sauce

Beef Bottom Round Steaks (6 oz).directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim meat of all excess fat and sliverskin. Using accurate scale - cut 6 oz portions. Layout on paper-lined hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Beef Bottom Round Steaks (6 oz).name: Beef Bottom Round Steaks (6 oz)

Warm Baked Peaches or Nectarines.directions: Cut the peaches or nectarines in half. Remove the pits. Place them, cut side up, in a well-buttered half-size hotel pan or ovenproof dish. Split the vanilla bean and scrape the seeds into the sugar. Sprinkle the fruit with the sugar and lemon juice. Place a small piece of butter in the center of each fruit half and bake at 350Â°F (180Â°C) until tender and lightly browned, approximately 20 minutes. Serve warm with Pastry Cream or ice cream.
Warm Baked Peaches or Nectarines.name: Warm Baked Peaches or Nectarines

Marinated London Broil.directions: Combine the marinade ingredients in a hotel pan. Add the flank steak to the marinade and coat completely. Allow the meat to marinate for at least 4 hours. Grill the steak rare to medium rare. If cooked further, the meat will become extremely tough. Carve into 1â„4-inch- (6-millimeter-) thick slices, cutting diagonally across the grain.
Marinated London Broil.name: Marinated London Broil

Chopped Fresh Herbs.directions: Wash all herbs in salad spinner. Dry well. Using vegetable-designated cutting board, chop to desired consistency.
Chopped Fresh Herbs.name: Chopped Fresh Herbs

Robert Sauce.directions: SautÃ© 8 ounces (240 grams) chopped onion in 1 ounce (30 grams) whole butter. Add 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) dry white wine and reduce by two-thirds. Add demi-glace and simmer for 10 minutes. Strain and then add 2 teaspoons (10 milliliters) prepared Dijon mustard and 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) granulated sugar. If the finished Robert sauce is garnished with sliced sour pickles, preferably cornichons, it is known as CharcutiÃ¨re. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Robert Sauce.name: Robert Sauce

Ice Cream Base.directions: Combine the milk and cream in a heavy saucepan and bring to a boil. Add the vanilla bean (if using). Whisk the egg yolks and sugar together in a mixing bowl. Temper the eggs with one-third of the hot milk. Return the egg mixture to the saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the custard reaches 180Â°F to 185Â°F (82Â°C to 85Â°C). Pour through a fine mesh strainer into a clean bowl. Chill the cooked ice cream base in an ice bath, then refrigerate overnight before processing. VARIATIONS: Chocolate Ice Creamâ€”Add approximately 9 ounces (270 grams) finely chopped bittersweet chocolate per quart (liter) of ice cream base. Add the chocolate to the hot mixture after it has been strained. Stir until completely melted. Cappuccino Ice Creamâ€”Steep the hot milk and cream with the vanilla bean and 2 or 3 cinnamon sticks. After the ice cream base is made, stir in 1â€“1 1/2 fluid ounces (30â€“45 milliliters) coffee ex-tract. Brandied Cherry Ice Creamâ€”Drain the liquid from one 16-ounce (500-gram) can tart, pitted cherries. Soak the cherries in 1 1/2 fluid ounces (45 milliliters) brandy. Reduce the sugar to 16 ounces (480 grams) and prepare the ice cream base as directed, omitting the vanilla bean. Add the brandy-soaked cherries to the cooled custard before processing.
Ice Cream Base.name: Ice Cream Base

San Francisco Sourdough Bread.directions: Sprinkle the dry yeast over 2 fluid ounces (60 milliliters) warm water and set aside until dis-solved and foamy. In the bowl of a mixer fitted with a dough hook, combine the starter and the remaining warm water. Add 6 ounces (180 grams) bread flour. Stir until a dough forms, then add the yeast mixture. Knead 5 minutes on medium speed. Add the remaining flour and the salt. Knead until the dough is smooth and elastic, approximately 10 minutes. Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl and cover with a damp cloth. Ferment the dough in a warm place, approximately 80Â°F to 90Â°F (27Â°C to 32Â°C), until doubled. Punch down the dough and shape it into a round loaf. Place the loaf on a greased and corn-meal-dusted sheet pan. Proof the dough in a warm place, covered with a damp cloth, until it has risen to 2 1/2 times its original size. Brush the risen loaf with the beaten egg white and score the top of the loaf with a sharp knife. Bake at 450Â°F (230Â°C), with a pan of boiling water underneath the oven rack, for 10 minutes. 10. Reduce the oven temperature to 375Â°F (190Â°C), remove the water and continue baking until the loaf is well browned, approximately 35 to 45 minutes.
San Francisco Sourdough Bread.name: San Francisco Sourdough Bread

Tournedos.directions: Working on a meat designated cutting board - trim tenderloin of the chain, excess fat and the sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into tournedos of desired size. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Tournedos.name: Tournedos

Matzo Balls.directions: Beat the eggsssss with the water. Stir in the fat or butter. Add matzo meal, salt and white pepper. The batter should be as thick as mashed potatoes. Chill for at least 1 hour. Bring 2 quarts (2 liters) water to a gentle boil. Using a #70 portion scoop, shape the batter into balls. Carefully drop each ball into the hot water. Cover and simmer until fully cooked, approximately 30 minutes. Remove the matzo balls from the water and serve in hot chicken soup.
Matzo Balls.name: Matzo Balls

White Wine Marinade.directions: Combine all ingredients. Use approximately 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) marinade for each double breast of chicken.
White Wine Marinade.name: White Wine Marinade

Soy Molasses Vinaigrette.directions: 1 Combine the molasses, rice vinegar, soy sauce and ginger in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and remove from the heat immediately. Allow the mixture to rest, undisturbed, for 1 hour. 2 Strain and chill the molasses mixture. Add the oil at service time.
Soy Molasses Vinaigrette.name: Soy Molasses Vinaigrette

Venison Medallions (3 oz).directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim venison of all sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into 3 oz medallions. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator
Venison Medallions (3 oz).name: Venison Medallions (3 oz)

Persillade.directions: Combine the garlic, parsley and bread crumbs. Drizzle the butter over the mixture and toss to blend. Sprinkle the persillade over cooked meats or vegetables as a topping, then place the dish un-der a broiler until lightly browned.
Persillade.name: Persillade

Champagne Cream Sauce.directions: Heat the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and bay leaves and sautÃ© until the onion is translucent, approximately 3 minutes. Add the wine, champagne and crab and reduce by half. Add the cream and reduce by half, or until the sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Add the salt and pepper. Strain the sauce through a china cap, pressing well to remove all liquid from the shells, and then add the sour cream. Blend the sauce with a few pulses of an immersion blender just enough to froth the sauce. Keep warm for service.
Champagne Cream Sauce.name: Champagne Cream Sauce

Mint and Celeriac Sauce.directions: Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the shallots, garlic and celeriac and sautÃ© until tender, but not brown. 2 Add the vinegar and reduce au sec. 3 Add the wine and mint and reduce by half. 4 Add the demi-glace and simmer for 30 minutes. Strain and keep warm for service. The sauce can be made up to one day in advance and refrigerated, then reheated as needed.
Mint and Celeriac Sauce.name: Mint and Celeriac Sauce

Supr\u00c3\u00aame Sauce.directions: Simmer the veloutÃ© sauce with the mushroom trimmings until reduced by one-fourth. Gradually whisk in the cream and return to a simmer. Adjust the seasonings. Strain through a china cap lined with cheesecloth.
Supr\u00c3\u00aame Sauce.name: SuprÃªme Sauce

Crayfish Butter.directions: Grind 8 ounces (240 grams) cooked crayfish meat, shells and/or coral with 1 pound (480 grams) butter. Place in a saucepan and clarify. Strain the butter through a fine chinois lined with cheesecloth. Refrigerate, then remove the butterfat when firm.
Crayfish Butter.name: Crayfish Butter

Pears Poached in Red Wine.directions: Peel and core the pears, leaving the stems intact. Combine the remaining ingredients in a large nonreactive saucepan. Arrange the pears in the liquid in a single layer. Place the pears on the stove top over a medium-high flame. Bring to just below a boil, then immediately reduce the heat and allow the liquid to simmer gently. Cover with a round of parchment paper if necessary to keep the pears submerged. Continue poaching the pears until tender, approximately 1 to 11â„2 hours. Remove the sauce-pan from the stove and allow the pears to cool in the liquid. Remove the pears from the poaching liquid and return the liquid to the stove top. Reduce un-til the liquid is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, then strain. Serve the pears chilled or at room temperature in a pool of the reduced wine syrup.
Pears Poached in Red Wine.name: Pears Poached in Red Wine

Turtle Cheesecake.directions: In a deep saucepan, bring the sugar, corn syrup and water to a boil. Wash down any crystals that cling to the sides of the pan with a brush dipped in water. Cook the mixture without stirring until it turns a golden caramel color, approximately 350Â°F (175Â°C). Add the honey and heated cream; be aware that the caramel mixture will rise when these in-gredients are added. Reboil the mixture until it darkens to a medium amber color, approx-imately 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat and add walnuts and pecans. Let cool to room temperature, then stir in the vanilla. Spread the warmed icing over the cheesecakes. Once the caramel topping has cooled, deco-rate with CrÃ¨me Chantilly (if using). Let the caramel filling set before cutting.
Turtle Cheesecake.name: Turtle Cheesecake

Chocolate Caramel Mousse.directions: 1 Place the sugar in a large heavy saucepan. Add enough water to make a wet sand, approxi-mately 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters). Place the pan over medium-high heat. Cook the sugar to a caramel stage, periodically brushing down the sides of the pot with water to prevent any sugar crystals from building up. 2 Meanwhile, place the cream and butter in a small pot and bring to a boil. Set aside until need-ed. 3 Combine the chocolates in a large bowl. Set aside. 4 When the caramel reaches a dark brown color, remove from the heat and slowly add the cream-and-butter mixture. Be very careful of the boiling caramel because serious burns can result. When all of the cream has been added, strain the mixture over the bowl of chopped chocolates. Let the chocolate and cream rest for approximately 1 minute and then whisk to-gether until the chocolate is fully melted. 5 Set aside the chocolate ganache until cooled to room temperature. Once cooled, whisk in half of the whipped cream. Fold in the remaining cream. Use the mousse immediately.
Chocolate Caramel Mousse.name: Chocolate Caramel Mousse

Buttermilk Pancakes.directions: Sift the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt together. Combine the buttermilk, melted butter and eggs and add them to the dry ingredients. Mix just until the ingredients are combined. If the griddle is not well seasoned, coat it lightly with clarified butter. Once its temperature reaches 375Â°F (190Â°C), drop the batter onto it in 2-fluid-ounce (60-milliliter) portions using a ladle, portion scoop or batter portioner. When bubbles appear on the pancakeâ€™s surface and the bottom is browned, flip the pancake to finish cooking. VARIATIONS: Blueberry Pancakesâ€”Gently stir 1 pint (480 milliliters) fresh or frozen blueberries into the batter. If using frozen berries, drain them thoroughly, then pat dry with paper towels before adding them to the batter. Serve with blueberry syrup or compote.
Buttermilk Pancakes.name: Buttermilk Pancakes

Veal Velout\u00c3\u00a9.directions: Heat the butter in a heavy saucepan. Add the flour and cook to make a blond roux. Gradually add the stock to the roux, stirring constantly with a whisk to prevent lumps. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. (Seasonings are optional; their use depends on the season-ings in the stock and the sauceâ€™s intended use.) Simmer and reduce to 1 gallon (3.8 liters), approximately 30 minutes. Strain through a china cap lined with cheesecloth. Melted butter may be carefully ladled over the surface of the sauce to prevent a skin from forming. Hold for service or cool in a water bath.
Veal Velout\u00c3\u00a9.name: Veal VeloutÃ©

Country Biscuits.directions: Sift the dry ingredients together, making sure they are blended thoroughly. Cut in the butter. The mixture should look mealy; do not overmix. Add the milk and stir, combining only until the mixture holds together. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface; knead until it forms one mass, approxi-mately five or six kneadings. Roll out the dough to a thickness of 1ï€¯2 inch (1.2 centimeters)
Country Biscuits.name: Country Biscuits

Lemongrass Oil.directions: Place all of the ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over low heat. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and allow the flavored oil to stand overnight at room temperature. Strain before using.
Lemongrass Oil.name: Lemongrass Oil

Glace de Volaille.directions: Simmer the stock over very low heat. Be careful not to let it burn, and skim it often. As it reduces and the volume decreases, transfer the liquid into progressively smaller sauce-pans. Strain the liquid each time it is transferred into a smaller saucepan. Strain it a final time, cool and refrigerate. A properly made glaze will keep for several months under refrigeration.
Glace de Volaille.name: Glace de Volaille

Rolled Souffl\u00c3\u00a9.directions: Grease a half-sheet pan with butter and line it with parchment paper. Heat 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) butter in a small saucepan. Add the flour and cook to make a blond roux. Slowly add the milk to the roux to form a paste. Bring slowly to a simmer and continue to cook for 10 minutes, stirring constantly. Transfer the sauce to a stainless steel bowl. Beat the egg yolks into the sauce. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites with a balloon whisk until stiff, shiny peaks form. Stir approximately one-third of the whites into the sauce and yolk mixture. Gently fold in another one-third of the whites and repeat with the last one-third of the whites. Fold in the Parmesan. Spread the mixture onto the prepared half-sheet pan. Bake at 350Â°F (180Â°C) until done, ap-proximately 15 minutes. Keep the oven door closed during cooking. Remove the soufflÃ© from the oven and separate it from the edges of the pan with a paring knife. Turn the soufflÃ© out onto a clean surface. Spread the Duxelles over the entire surface of the soufflÃ©. Roll it up into a tight log, making sure the paper does not get rolled up with the soufflÃ©. Trim the ends from the soufflÃ©. For buffet service, slice three or four pieces from the soufflÃ© and place the remaining soufflÃ© on a platter. Nappe with Aurora sauce and garnish with the watercress and parsley.
Rolled Souffl\u00c3\u00a9.name: Rolled SoufflÃ©

Croutons.directions: Heat the butter in a small sautÃ© or sauce pan over medium heat to 325 (163C). Trim the crust from the white bread and cut into uniform cubes. Pan fry the croutons in small batches in the butter until golden brown and cooked through. Stir frequently for even browning. As each batch is done remove to absorbent paper towel and toss with salt while still warm. Remove to a clean bowl and continue until all the croutons are fried
Croutons.name: Croutons

Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Br\u00c3\u00bbl\u00c3\u.directions: Place the cream and the vanilla beans in a large, heavy saucepan. Heat just to a boil. Whisk the egg yolks and sugar together until smooth and well blended. Temper the egg mixture with one-third of the hot cream. Return the egg mixture to the sauce-pan and cook, stirring constantly, until very thick. Do not allow the custard to boil. Remove from the heat and strain into a clean bowl. Cool over an ice bath, stirring occasionally. To serve, place fresh berries in the bottom of each Tulipe Cookie cup. Top with several spoonsful of custard. Sprinkle granulated sugar over the top of the custard and caramelize with a propane torch. Serve immediately. VARIATION: Passion Fruit CrÃ¨me BrÃ»lÃ©eâ€”Replace 1/2 quart (500 milliliters) cream with 1/2 quart (500 milliliters) frozen, thawed passion fruit purÃ©e.
Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Br\u00c3\u00bbl\u00c3\u.name: CrÃ¨me BrÃ»lÃ©e

Pinto Beans.directions: 1 Soak the pinto beans in water for several hours and then drain them. Put them in a saucepan and add enough cold water to cover them thoroughly. Pierce the jalapeÃ±o several times with a paring knife and add it to the beans. Bring the beans to a boil, add the onion, cover and re-duce to a simmer. 2 Adding enough water to keep the beans barely covered, allow the beans to simmer until they are tender but not mushy, approximately 45 minutes. When the beans are nearly done, allow the liquid to reduce slightly and thicken into a sauce. 3 Season the beans to taste with salt and discard the jalapeÃ±o
Pinto Beans.name: Pinto Beans

Red Pepper Coulis.directions: Heat the oil and sweat the garlic and onion until translucent, without browning. Add the bell peppers and sweat until tender. Deglaze the pan with the wine. Add the stock, bring to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. PurÃ©e in a blender or food processor and strain through a china cap. Adjust the consistency and seasonings and hold for service.
Red Pepper Coulis.name: Red Pepper Coulis

Mulligatawny Soup.directions: In a saucepot, heat the butter over medium heat; add the mirepoix and sautÃ© for 5 minutes. Add the flour and curry powder and cook to form a blond roux. Add the stock. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes. Add the chicken, apple and mushroom and cook for 15 more minutes. Finish with the milk and season with salt and white pepper. Garnish with fresh chives.
Mulligatawny Soup.name: Mulligatawny Soup

Bacon Lardons.directions: Cut into bacon into 1/2" pieces. Set a saute pan over medium heat - add bacon. Cook, stirring frequently until most of the fat has rendered and the bacon is crispy, about 6 - 8 minutes. Remove lardons with a slotted spoon and place on paper towel.
Bacon Lardons.name: Bacon Lardons

Ricotta Filling.directions: In the bowl of a mixer fitted with a paddle, combine the cream cheese and ricotta on low speed until no lumps remain. Add the sugar; gradually add the eggs and scrape down the bowl between additions. Add the vanilla extract and then the flour and combine well.
Ricotta Filling.name: Ricotta Filling

Mashed Potatoes.directions: Wash and peel the potatoes. Cut each potato into four to six uniform-sized pieces. Place the potatoes in a pot, cover them with water and add 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) salt to the water. Bring the water to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook until the potatoes are ten-der. Do not overcook the potatoes. When the potatoes are cooked, drain them well in a colander. The potatoes must be very dry. Transfer them to the bowl of an electric mixer. Using the whip attachment, whip the potatoes for 30 to 45 seconds. Scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl and whip for another 15 sec-onds or until the potatoes are smooth and free of lumps. The potatoes must be smooth before adding any liquids or they will remain lumpy. Add the butter, milk and seasonings. Whip on low speed to incorporate all of the ingredients. Scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl and whip again for several seconds. Adjust consis-tency and seasoning. VARIATIONS: Garlic Mashed Potatoesâ€”Sweat 1 ounce (30 grams) chopped garlic in the melted butter for 5 to 10 minutes without browning. Strain the butter if desired. Add the hot garlic butter in place of the melted butter in the recipe. Horseradish Mashed Potatoesâ€”Add 1 ounce (30 grams) freshly grated horseradish to the pota-toes with the seasonings. Truffle Mashed Potatoesâ€”Add 11â„2 fluid ounces (45 milliliters) truffle oil to the potatoes with the seasonings.
Mashed Potatoes.name: Mashed Potatoes

Piquant Sauce.directions: Combine 1 ounce (30 grams) shallots, 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) white wine and 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) white wine vinegar. Reduce the mixture by two-thirds. Then add demi-glace and simmer for 10 minutes. Add 2 ounces (60 grams) diced cornichons, 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) fresh tarragon, 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) fresh parsley and 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) fresh chervil. Do not strain. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Piquant Sauce.name: Piquant Sauce

Dark Chocolate Glaze.directions: 1 Bring the milk, glucose and syrup to a boil, stirring carefully. Do not whisk vigorously or you will incorporate too much air. 2 In a bowl, combine the dark chocolate coating or pÃ¢te Ã  glacer and the bittersweet chocolate. 3 Slowly pour the milk mixture onto the chocolate. Let it sit for approximately a minute. Using a whisk, stir the mixture slowly to incorporate the chocolate and milk. 4 Keep the mixture refrigerated. When ready to use, warm it over a water bath to 100Â°F (38Â°C). If the temperature gets any hotter the glaze will not be as shiny.
Dark Chocolate Glaze.name: Dark Chocolate Glaze

Saut\u00c3\u00a9ed Veal Scallops with Wh.directions: Pound the scallops to a uniform thickness, as described in Chapter 14, Veal. Heat a sautÃ© pan and add enough clarified butter to coat the bottom of the pan. Dredge the scallops in flour seasoned with salt and pepper and add to the pan in a single layer. SautÃ© on each side for 1 to 2 minutes. As the first scallops are done, remove them to a warm platter and sautÃ© the remaining scallops. This can be done in several batches, adding additional clarified butter as needed. Add the chopped shallots to the pan and sautÃ©. Deglaze the pan with the wine and lemon juice. Add the stock and reduce by half. Swirl in the butter (montÃ© au beurre). Adjust the seasonings with salt and pepper. Serve two scallops per person with approximately 1 ounce (30 milliliters) sauce. Garnish with lemon wedges.
Saut\u00c3\u00a9ed Veal Scallops with Wh.name: SautÃ©ed Veal Scallops with White Wine Lemon Sauce

Jumbo Cinnamon Buns.directions: In the bowl of a mixer fitted with a dough hook, combine the buttermilk, yeast, egg, egg yolks and vanilla. Add the flour, sugar, salt and softened butter. Mix on medium speed until well blended, until a windowpane has been obtained and the dough reaches approximately 75Â°F (24Â°C). Ferment the dough until doubled, approximately 1 hour. Meanwhile, prepare the filling. Whisk together the melted butter, cinnamon and brown sugar. Set aside. Roll the fermented dough into a rectangle measuring 18 inches X 30 inches (45 centimeters X 75 centimeters). Spread the filling evenly over the entire surface of the dough. Sprinkle with the pecans and raisins (if using). Starting with the longer side, roll the dough into a spiral. Cut into 24 pieces, each approximately 1 1/2 inches (3.7 centimeters) thick. Place the rolls close together, cut side up, on a pa-per-lined sheet pan and allow them to rise until the rolls have increased 70 percent in volume. Bake at 350Â°F (180Â°C) until golden brown, approximately 20 to 25 minutes. Cool slightly, then top with Powdered Sugar Glaze.
Jumbo Cinnamon Buns.name: Jumbo Cinnamon Buns

R\u00c3\u00b6sti Potatoes.directions: Partially cook the potatoes in salted water until almost done. Drain and cool the potatoes, then peel and coarsely grate them. Heat the bacon fat and lard in a heavy, shallow 10-inch (25-centimeter) skillet with sloping sides until quite hot. Spread half the potatoes over the bottom of the pan; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover with the remaining potatoes and cook over medium-high heat until the bottom turns brown and crusty, approximately 10 minutes. Turn the potatoes in one piece. This is easiest to do by placing a large plate over the pan and turning both together so that the potatoes fall onto the plate. Slip the turned-over potatoes off the plate back into the pan, browned side up. Cook until the bottom is browned. Before serving, smooth the edges of the potatoes with a spatula. Sprinkle with salt and brush the edge of the pan with whole butter. It will melt and run into the potatoes. VARIATION: Cheddar Cheese RÃ¶sti Potatoesâ€”Make two thin cakes from the coarsely grated potatoes. Top one with a layer of 7 ounces (210 grams) sour cream, 2 ounces (60 grams) cubed sharp Cheddar cheese and 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) chopped chives. Top with the other cake. Dot with 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) whole butter and bake in a 400Â°F (200Â°C) oven for 15 minutes.
R\u00c3\u00b6sti Potatoes.name: RÃ¶sti Potatoes

Brioche Loaf.directions: Portion and shape the chilled dough as desired. Place the shaped dough in well-greased pans and proof at room temperature until doubled. Bake at 375Â°F (190Â°C) until the brioche is a dark golden brown and sounds hollow. Baking time will vary depending on the temperature of the dough and the size of the rolls or loaves being baked.
Brioche Loaf.name: Brioche Loaf

Pico de Gallo (Tomato Salsa).directions: Combine all ingredients and gently toss. Adjust seasonings and refrigerate.
Pico de Gallo (Tomato Salsa).name: Pico de Gallo (Tomato Salsa)

Choron Sauce.directions: Combine 2 ounces (60 grams) tomato paste and 2 fluid ounces (60 milliliters) heavy cream; add the mixture to a bÃ©arnaise.
Choron Sauce.name: Choron Sauce

Creole R\u00c3\u00a9moulade.directions: Combine the egg yolks, salt and lemon juice in a mixing bowl or a food processor. While whisking, add the oil in drops to form an emulsion. When the mixture thickens, the remain-ing oil can be added in a slow, steady stream. Add the hot water and mix to lighten the may-onnaiseâ€™s color. Adjust the seasoning with salt, white pepper and additional lemon juice as necessary. Stir in the remaining ingredients by hand. If the sauce is too thick, thin it with 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) red wine vinegar into which 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) sugar has been dis-solved.
Creole R\u00c3\u00a9moulade.name: Creole RÃ©moulade

Cherry Confit.directions: SautÃ© the onion in the butter without coloring. Add the cherries. Add the brandy and flambÃ©. Add the wine and vinegar; cook until almost dry. Serve warm or at room temperature with charcuterie items or grilled or roasted meats.
Cherry Confit.name: Cherry Confit

Cream Sauce.directions: Add to bÃ©chamel 8â€“12 fluid ounces (240â€“360 milliliters) scalded cream and a few drops of lemon juice.
Cream Sauce.name: Cream Sauce

Lobster Stock.directions: 1 Melt the butter in a saucepot. Sweat the onion, leek, fennel and carrot until soft, approximate-ly 10 minutes. FlambÃ© with the brandy as described in Chapter 7 and add the lobster shells. Add the wine and reduce by half. 2 Add the tomato juice, water, bay leaves and cayenne pepper. Bring to a boil, skim and sim-mer for 1 hour. Strain and cool
Lobster Stock.name: Lobster Stock

Pink Peppercorn Beurre Blanc.directions: Add 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) coarsely crushed pink peppercorns to the shallot-wine reduction when making beurre rouge. Garnish the finished sauce with whole pink peppercorns.
Pink Peppercorn Beurre Blanc.name: Pink Peppercorn Beurre Blanc

Chocolate Cutouts.directions: Melt and temper chocolate. Spread on marble and using sharp knife,or cutters, cut out desire shapes
Chocolate Cutouts.name: Chocolate Cutouts

Saut\u00c3\u00a9ed Calves Liver with Oni.directions: SautÃ© the onions in 1 fluid ounce (30 milliliters) clarified butter until golden brown. Season with salt and pepper. Add the wine, cover and braise until the onions are tender, approximately 10 minutes. Stir in the parsley. Dredge the liver in flour seasoned with salt and pepper. In a separate pan, sautÃ© the liver in the remaining clarified butter until done. The liver should be slightly pink in the middle. Serve the liver with a portion of the onions and their cooking liquid.
Saut\u00c3\u00a9ed Calves Liver with Oni.name: SautÃ©ed Calves Liver with Onions

Cilantro Chutney.directions: 1 Place all ingredients in a blender and blend to a pestolike consistency.
Cilantro Chutney.name: Cilantro Chutney

P\u00c3\u00a9rigueux Sauce.directions: Add finely diced truffles to Madeira sauce. PÃ©rigourdine sauce is the same as pÃ©rigueux, except that the truffles are cut into relatively thick slices. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
P\u00c3\u00a9rigueux Sauce.name: PÃ©rigueux Sauce

Duxelles.directions: Chop the mushrooms very finely. SautÃ© the shallots and garlic in the butter until tender. Add the mushrooms and sautÃ© until dry. Season with salt and pepper and add the parsley. Cool and then use the duxelles as a stuffing for vegetables or as a flavoring ingredient in other recipes.
Duxelles.name: Duxelles

Milanaise Sauce.directions: SautÃ© 5 ounces (150 grams) sliced mushrooms in 1â„2 ounce (15 grams) whole butter. Add tomato sauce and then stir in 5 ounces (150 grams) cooked ham (julienne) and 5 ounces (150 grams) cooked tongue (julienne). Bring to a simmer. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Milanaise Sauce.name: Milanaise Sauce

Carpaccio.directions: Place the tenderloin in the freezer until nearly frozen. Combine the mayonnaise with the mustard. Season with salt and pepper. Slice the nearly frozen tenderloin on an electric slicer very thin, almost transparent. On eight very cold plates, arrange one slightly overlapping layer of thin slices of beef. Sprinkle each plate of beef with 1â„2 teaspoon (2.5 milliliters) capers, a generous amount of cracked black pepper, salt and 1â„2 ounce (15 grams) sliced onions. Drizzle with 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) oil and spoon 1â„2 ounce (15 grams) mayonnaise in the center of each plate. Serve very cold.
Carpaccio.name: Carpaccio

Duck Stock.directions: Cut the duck into 10 pieces. Take the breast meat off the frame and reserve for other use. Place duck and trimmings in a stockpot and cover with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.
Duck Stock.name: Duck Stock

Red Wine Marinade.directions: Combine all ingredients. Place the meat in the marinade and marinate for the desired time. Tender, farm-raised game may need only 30 minutes; older, wild animals may need 1 to 2 days.
Red Wine Marinade.name: Red Wine Marinade

Bercy Sauce.directions: SautÃ© 2 ounces (60 grams) finely diced shallots in butter. Then add 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) dry white wine and 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) fish stock. Reduce this mixture by one-third and add the fish veloutÃ©. Finish with butter and garnish with chopped parsley. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Bercy Sauce.name: Bercy Sauce

Veal Stew Meat.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim veal shoulder (chuck) of all sliverskin. Cut into cubes of desired size, ensuring that they are of uniform size Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Veal Stew Meat.name: Veal Stew Meat

Chicken Curry Spread.directions: Cut the chicken into small pieces and place in a food processor. Pulse until a fine texture is obtained. Add the remaining ingredients and mix until blended. Refrigerate until needed, but use within 2 days. VARIATION: For a mixture that can be piped into barquettes or used as a garnish, process the chicken until very smooth and add 2â€“3 ounces (60â€“90 grams) plain cream cheese.
Chicken Curry Spread.name: Chicken Curry Spread

Passion Fruit Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Chiboust.directions: Bring the passion fruit juice and cream to a boil in a large stainless saucepan. 2 Whisk the egg yolks and 3 ounces (90 grams) of the sugar to a ribbon, then add the corn-starch. Temper with half of the hot cream. 3 Return the tempered egg mixture to the saucepan and bring to a boil while vigorously whisk-ing. Once the custard has come to a boil and thickened, remove from heat and pour into a clean bowl. 4 Stir the softened sheet gelatin into the cream until it is dissolved and smooth. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and lightly dust the surface with powdered sugar to prevent a crust from forming. Do not chill the cream. 5 Meanwhile, prepare an Italian meringue as described on page 1173 with the egg whites, re-maining sugar and water. Delicately fold the Italian meringue into the hot passion fruit cream. 6 Use immediately. Pour the cream into a serving container or torte or other mold before it sets. This will keep refrigerated for several days.
Passion Fruit Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Chiboust.name: Passion Fruit CrÃ¨me Chiboust

Zucchini Bread.directions: Combine all ingredients using the muffin method. Bake in two greased loaf pans at 350Â°F (180Â°C), approximately 1 hour.
Zucchini Bread.name: Zucchini Bread

Muscat Pastry Cream.directions: 1 Reserve 2 fluid ounces (60 milliliters) of the milk. Place the remaining milk in a saucepot and add the vanilla bean and its seeds. Scald the milk. 2 Combine the cornstarch with 7 ounces (210 grams) of the sugar, the salt and the reserved milk and whisk until smooth. Add the eggs and yolks and mix until they are incorporated and the mixture is smooth. 3 Temper the cornstarch mixture with some of the scalded milk and return the mixture to the saucepot with the remaining milk. Whisk and cook over medium heat until the mixture has thickened and begins to boil. 4 Remove the pastry cream from the heat and pour into a hotel pan. Remove the vanilla bean. Lay plastic wrap over the surface of the pastry cream and refrigerate until completely cold. 5 Whip the chilled pastry cream until smooth, approximately 1 minute. Add the wine and whip to combine. 6 Whip the heavy cream with the remaining sugar to stiff peaks. Combine the whipped pastry cream and the whipped cream and whip together, scraping down the bowl as necessary. Re-frigerate until ready to use.
Muscat Pastry Cream.name: Muscat Pastry Cream

Herb Mayonnaise.directions: 1 Stir all the ingredients together until the herbs are evenly distributed throughout the mayon-naise. Chill until ready to use.
Herb Mayonnaise.name: Herb Mayonnaise

Orange Juice (fresh).directions: Wash oranges.                                                                                         2) Juice oranges by hand or with electric juicer.                                                                             3) Strain through fine mesh strainer.
Orange Juice (fresh).name: Orange Juice (fresh)

Strawberry Cr\u00c3\u00aapes Fitzgerald.directions: Combine the cream cheese, sour cream, vanilla extract and 1 ounce (30 grams) sugar in a mixing bowl and beat until smooth. Place 3 tablespoons (45 milliliters) of the filling on one end of each crÃªpe; roll the crÃªpes around the filling and then refrigerate them while preparing the topping. To make the topping, heat the butter and the remaining sugar in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Add the strawberries and lemon juice. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer until the liquid thickens, ap-proximately 10 to 12 minutes. Add the maraschino liqueur and flambÃ© as described on page 341. To serve, place two crÃªpes on each of eight plates and spoon approximately 6 fluid ounces (180 milliliters) of warm strawberry topping over the crÃªpes.
Strawberry Cr\u00c3\u00aapes Fitzgerald.name: Strawberry CrÃªpes Fitzgerald

Ladyfingers.directions: Sift the flour and cornstarch together. Set aside. Whip the egg yolks and vanilla together in the bowl of a mixer fitted with the whip attach-ment until the mixture is thick and creamy. Simultaneously, in a second mixer fitted with the whip attachment, whip the egg whites and granulated sugar until the mixture holds stiff peaks. Using a balloon whisk, gently stir the egg whites to restore a smooth appearance. Add the whipped yolks all at once into the egg whites. Gently fold the two together using a rubber spatula or a balloon whisk until the mixture is streaked in appearance and is not completely combined. Gently fold in the flour, taking care not to deflate the batter. Place the batter into a pastry bag fitted with a medium plain tip. Pipe 4-inch- (10-centimeter-) long cookies onto paper-lined sheet pans. Sprinkle the surface of the piped batter with powdered sugar. Let it sit for a few minutes until the powdered sugar dissolves. Sprinkle a second time with more powdered sugar. Bake immediately at 400Â°F (200Â°C) until the cookies bounce back when lightly pressed, ap-proximately 9 to 11 minutes.
Ladyfingers.name: Ladyfingers

Mornay Sauce.directions: Add to bÃ©chamel 4 ounces (120 grams) grated GruyÃ¨re and 1 ounce (30 grams) grated Parmesan. Thin as desired with scalded cream. Remove the sauce from the heat and swirl in 2 ounces (60 grams) whole butter.
Mornay Sauce.name: Mornay Sauce

Pheasant Stock.directions: Cut the pheasant into pieces. Take the breast meat off the frame and reserve for other use. Place pheasant, chicken backs and necks, and trimmings in a stockpot and cover with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.
Pheasant Stock.name: Pheasant Stock

Basic Fudge Frosting.directions: Place the powdered sugar in the bowl of a mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. Bring the butter, shortening, corn syrup, water and salt to a boil in a saucepan over medium high heat. Remove the pan from heat. With the machine running, pour the hot mixture over the powdered sugar. Whip until the mixture is smooth and fluffy. Stir in the vanilla. The icing can be used immediately. VARIATION: Cocoa Fudge Frostingâ€”Sift 3 ounces (90 grams) cocoa powder with the powdered sugar. Add 2 ounces (60 grams) melted unsalted butter with the shortening.
Basic Fudge Frosting.name: Basic Fudge Frosting

Brennan's Lemon Butter Sauce.directions: Combine the brown sauce and lemon juice in a large saucepan. Working the pan on and off the direct heat, add the butter a bit at a time, whisking the sauce smooth between additions. Adjust the flavor with additional lemon juice if necessary. Transfer the sauce to a clean con-tainer and hold at room temperature for service. Use the sauce within 2 hours or discard it.
Brennan's Lemon Butter Sauce.name: Brennan's Lemon Butter Sauce

Thyme Merlot Sauce.directions: 1 SautÃ© the garlic and shallots in the clarified butter until translucent. Add the wine, bay leaf and thyme and reduce by half. Add the stock and reduce by half again. Strain and season to taste. Hold for service
Thyme Merlot Sauce.name: Thyme Merlot Sauce

Caramelized Berry Sauce.directions: Combine the sugar and water in a large saucepot. Bring to a boil and cook to a rich, golden brown. Add all the berries to the caramelized sugar. Cook for 1 minute. Add the veal stock and bring to a boil. Lower the heat to a simmer and reduce by half. Strain the sauce through a fine chinois and keep warm for service.
Caramelized Berry Sauce.name: Caramelized Berry Sauce

Classic Genoise.directions: Whisk the eggs and sugar together in a large mixer bowl. Place the bowl over a bain marie and whisk the mixture continuously to warm the eggs to approximately 105Â°F to 113Â°F (40Â°C to 45Â°C). When the eggs are warm, remove the bowl from the bain marie and attach it to a mixer fitted with the whip attachment. Whip the egg-and-sugar mixture at medium speed until the mix-ture is cool and forms thick ribbons, approximately 12 to 15 minutes. If using the melted butter, remove approximately one-eighth of the batter. Place it in a small bowl and mix it with the melted butter. Set aside. Using a rubber spatula or balloon whisk, delicately fold the flour into the remaining genoise batter. Carefully fold in the reserved butter-genoise mixture. Spread the batter immediately onto a paper-lined sheet pan. Bake at 425Â°F (220Â°C) until light brown and springy to the touch, approximately 10 minutes. VARIATION: Chocolate Genoiseâ€”Reduce the cake flour to 7 ounces (210 grams). Sift 2 ounces (60 grams) cocoa powder with the flour.
Classic Genoise.name: Classic Genoise

Flaky Pie Dough.directions: Cut butter into medium dice 3ï€¯8 inch (9 millimeters) square. Sift the flour onto a work surface or into a large bowl. Cut the butter into the flour mixture until fat is size of peas or peanuts Combine the buttermilk, salt, sugar and vanilla (if using) in a bowl with a whisk. Gradually add the buttermilk to the flour mixture. Mix gently until the dough holds together. Do not overmix or add too much liquid. Cover the dough with plastic wrap and chill thoroughly before using.
Flaky Pie Dough.name: Flaky Pie Dough

Clarified Butter.directions: Slowly warm the butter in a saucepan over low heat without boiling or agitation. As the butter melts, the milk solids rise to the top as a foam and the water sinks to the bottom. When the butter is completely melted, skim the milk solids from the top. When all the milk solids have been removed, ladle the butterfat into a clean saucepan, being careful to leave the water in the bottom of the pan. The clarified butter is now ready to use. One pound (454 grams) of whole butter will yield approximately 12 ounces (340 grams) of clarified butterâ€”a yield of 75%. Clarified butter will keep for extended periods in either the freezer or refrigerator.
Clarified Butter.name: Clarified Butter

Pesto Sauce.directions: Place one-third of the oil in a blender or food processor and add all the remaining ingredients. Blend or process until smooth. Add the remaining oil and blend a few seconds to incorporate. VARIATIONS: Walnut Pestoâ€”Substitute walnuts for pine nuts. Sun-Dried Tomato Pestoâ€”Add 1 ounce (30 grams) sun-dried tomatoes that have been softened in oil or water. Add additional oil as necessary.
Pesto Sauce.name: Pesto Sauce

Kirsch Mousse.directions: 1 Bring the Kirsch to a simmer over low heat. Remove from the heat, add the softened gelatin and stir until it is completely dissolved. 2 Stir the gelatin mixture into the heavy cream, then whip the cream to soft peaks. 3 Fold the whipped cream into the Pastry Cream and chill until ready to use
Kirsch Mousse.name: Kirsch Mousse

Fresh Tomato Vinaigrette for Pasta.directions: Dissolve the salt in the vinegar in a small stainless steel bowl. Whisk in the olive oil. Then stir in the tomato, fresh herbs and shallot. Season with pepper. Use this vinaigrette to season up to 2 pounds (approximately 1 kilogram) of any type of cooked pasta, adjusting the seasonings before serving warm or chilled as an accompaniment to sandwiches or other foods.
Fresh Tomato Vinaigrette for Pasta.name: Fresh Tomato Vinaigrette for Pasta

Flaky Pie Dough Shell.directions: SHAPING CRUSTS  Crusts are shaped by rolling out the dough to fit into a pie pan or tart shell (mold) or to sit on top of fillings. Mealy, flaky and sweet doughs are all easier to roll out and work with if well chilled, as chilling keeps the fat firm and prevents stickiness. When rolling and shaping the dough, work on a clean, flat surface (wood or marble is best). Lightly dust the work surface, rolling pin and dough with pastry flour before starting to roll the dough. Also, work only with a manageable amount at a time: usually one crustâ€™s worth for a pie or standard-sized tart or enough for 10 to 12 tartlet shells.
Flaky Pie Dough Shell.name: Flaky Pie Dough Shell

Shirred Eggs with Ham.directions: Brush the interior of a 6-fluid-ounce (180-milliliter) ramekin with melted butter. Line the ramekin with the ham. Break the eggs into a cup and pour them carefully into the ramekin on top of the ham. Season with salt and pepper. Bake at 325Â°F (160Â°C) until the eggs begin to set, approximately 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from the oven, then add the cream and cheese. Return to the oven until the eggs are cooked and the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.
Shirred Eggs with Ham.name: Shirred Eggs with Ham

Frangelico Custard Sauce.directions: MISE EN PLACE â–º Split vanilla bean in half. â–º Set up an ice bath. â¶ In a heavy nonreactive saucepan, bring the half-and-half and vanilla bean just to a boil. â· Whisk the egg yolks and sugar together in a mixing bowl. Temper the egg mixture with approximately one-third of the hot half-and-half, then return the entire mixture to the saucepan with the remaining half-and-half. â¸ Cook the sauce over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it is thick enough to lightly coat the back of a spoon. Do not allow the mixture to go above 185Â°F (85Â°C) or the mixture will curdle. Do not allow the sauce to boil. â¹ As soon as the sauce thickens, remove it from the heat and pour it through a fine mesh strainer into a clean bowl. Chill the sauce over an ice bath, then cover and keep refrigerated. The sauce should last 3 to 4 days VARIATIONS: Frangelico Custard Sauceâ€”Omit the vanilla bean. Stir in 0.08 fluid ounce (2.5 milliliters/1/2 teaspoon) vanilla extract and 1 to 1.5 fluid ounces (30 to 45 milliliters) Frangelico, to taste.
Frangelico Custard Sauce.name: Frangelico Custard Sauce

Venison Medallions.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim venison of all sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into medallions of desired size. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator
Venison Medallions.name: Venison Medallions

Barley Risotto.directions: 1 Cook the barley in the water until barely done; strain. 2 Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, approximately 2 minutes. Add the barley and, stirring with a wooden spoon, completely coat the barley with the butter. 3 Increase the heat and add 4 fluid ounces (125 milliliters) stock. Stir until all the stock is ab-sorbed, then add the remaining stock. Cook until almost all the stock is absorbed and remove from heat. 4 Stir in the green onions and cheese, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Barley Risotto.name: Barley Risotto

Court Bouillon.directions: Combine all ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 45 minutes. Strain and use immediately or cool and refrigerate.
Court Bouillon.name: Court Bouillon

Veal Cutlets.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim veal of all sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into cutlets of desired size. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Veal Cutlets.name: Veal Cutlets

Hush Puppies (Deep-Fried Cornbread).directions: Combine all ingredients using the muffin method. Drop small scoops (using a #60 or #70 portion scoop) into deep fat at 375Â°F (190Â°C). Using the swimming method, deep-fry until golden brown. Remove from the fat and drain. Serve immediately.
Hush Puppies (Deep-Fried Cornbread).name: Hush Puppies (Deep-Fried Cornbread)

Pork Scallops.directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim pork loin of any fat or silverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into scallops of desired size. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Pork Scallops.name: Pork Scallops

Beer Beurre Blanc Sauce.directions: 1 Sweat the shallots in the 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) butter over medium heat for approxi-mately 2 minutes. Add the salt and pepper, vinegar, bay leaf, thyme and beer. 2 Reduce by two-thirds. 3 Whisk in the cold butter in pieces, moving the pan on and off the heat as necessary. Do not allow the sauce to boil. Adjust the seasonings, strain and hold in a bain marie for up to 2 hours. Serve with fried or grilled meat or poultry.
Beer Beurre Blanc Sauce.name: Beer Beurre Blanc Sauce

Orange Glaze.directions: 1 Combine the ingredients using a spatula.
Orange Glaze.name: Orange Glaze

Rouille.directions: 1 Tear the bread and place in the bowl of a food processor. Process for 40 seconds to make fresh bread crumbs. 2 Add the garlic and cayenne pepper and process to blend. 3 Slowly drizzle in the oil until the mixture resembles mayonnaise. Add a small amount of warm water if necessary to thin the sauce and make it creamier. 4 Adjust the seasoning with salt.
Rouille.name: Rouille

Cajun Spice Mix.directions: 1 Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Cajun Spice Mix.name: Cajun Spice Mix

Coconut Macadamia Cake.directions: 1 In a large bowl, whisk the yolks and sugar until well combined. Add the cream, then the coconut, vanilla extract and flour. Fold in the nuts. 2 In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites to medium stiff peaks. Fold one-third of the whipped egg whites into the coconut mixture, then delicately fold in the rest of the egg whites. 3 Divide the cake batter evenly between buttered and floured cake pans. Bake at 375Â°F (190Â°C) until the center of the cake bounces back when lightly pressed, approximately 20 minutes. Cool completely before using.
Coconut Macadamia Cake.name: Coconut Macadamia Cake

Mole.directions: Grind the cinnamon and allspice in a spice grinder. Stem and seed the guajillo and pasilla chiles. Break them into small pieces and simmer them in water for 15 minutes. Drain well. Combine the sesame seeds, pumpkin seeds and cumin seeds and fry them in a dry sautÃ© pan until well toasted. Slice the onion approximately 1/2 inch (1.2 centimeters) thick. Brush the slices with oil and grill until well colored. Roast the tomatoes over the open flame of a gas burner until they are evenly charred and blis-tered. Remove the cores, peel the tomatoes and chop them coarsely. Combine the cinnamon and allspice with the chiles, toasted seeds, onion, tomatoes, garlic, thyme, oregano and stock in a saucepan. Season with salt and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes. Remove from the heat, cool and remove the sprig of thyme. Blend the mixture in a blender until smooth. Strain through a china cap and stir in the choco-late until melted. Adjust the seasonings. Serve the mole over grilled chicken, turkey, duck, quail or a meat such as pork or rabbit. Or, reheat cooked turkey or chicken pieces in the sauce until hot and serve with a portion of the sauce.
Mole.name: Mole

Parisian Croissants.directions: Stir the flour, salt and sugar together in the bowl of a mixer fitted with a dough hook. Warm the milk to approximately 90Â°F (32Â°C). Stir in the yeast. Add the milk-and-yeast mixture to the dry ingredients. Stir until combined, then knead on medium speed for 10 minutes. Place the dough in a large floured bowl, cover and let rise until doubled in size, approximately 1 hour. Prepare the butter while the dough is rising. Place the butter in an even layer between two large pieces of plastic wrap and roll into a flat rectangle, approximately 8 inches X 11 inches (20 centimeters X 27.5 centimeters) and chill. After the dough has risen, punch it down. Roll out the dough into a large rectangle, approximately 1/2 inch (1.2 centimeters) thick and large enough to enclose the rectangle of butter. Place the unwrapped butter in the center of the dough and fold the dough around the butter, enclosing it completely. Roll out the block of dough into a long rectangle, approximately 1 inch (2.5 centimeters) thick. Fold the dough in thirds, a single book fold. This completes the first turn. Wrap the dough in plastic and chill for approximately 20 to 30 minutes. Repeat the rolling and folding process two more times, chilling the dough between each turn. When finished, wrap the dough well and chill it overnight before shaping and baking. To shape the dough into croissant rolls, cut off one-fourth of the block at a time, wrapping the rest and returning it to the refrigerator. Roll each section of dough into a large rectangle, about 1/4 inch (6 millimeters) thick. 10. Cut the dough into uniform triangles. Starting with the large end, roll each triangle into a crescent and place on a paper-lined sheet pan. 11. Brush lightly with egg wash. Proof until doubled, but do not allow the dough to become so warm that the butter melts. 12. Bake at 375Â°F (190Â°C) until golden brown, approximately 12 to 15 minutes.
Parisian Croissants.name: Parisian Croissants

Poached Eggs.directions: Bring the water to a simmer; add the salt and vinegar. Crack one egg into a cup and carefully add it to the water. Repeat with the other egg. Cook the eggs to the desired doneness, approximately 3 to 5 minutes. Remove them from the water with a slotted spoon and serve as desired or carefully lower them into ice water and re-frigerate for later use.
Poached Eggs.name: Poached Eggs

Callaloo with Crab.directions: Wash the callaloo or spinach. Remove the stems and tough ribs and chop coarsely. Heat the oil in a rondeau and sweat the diced onions. Add the green onions and garlic and sweat for 2 more minutes. Add the callaloo or spinach, coconut milk, milk, pumpkin, salt and pepper. Bring the soup to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Cook for 30 minutes. PurÃ©e half of the soup in a blender, food processor or food mill. Return it to the pot with the remaining soup. Pick over the crab meat to remove any bits of shell and add the meat to the soup. Adjust the seasonings and serve.
Callaloo with Crab.name: Callaloo with Crab

Orange Gastrique.directions: Combine the sugar and water and cook over medium heat until lightly caramelized. Add the zest, juice and star anise and stir together until the sugar is dissolved and the sauce is smooth. Add the stock and reduce until the sauce thickens and coats the back of a spoon. Stir in the honey and montÃ© au beurre. Serve the sauce with grilled or roasted chicken, duck, quail or pork.
Orange Gastrique.name: Orange Gastrique

Avocado Salsa.directions: In a mixing bowl, combine the bell peppers, onions, garlic, lemon juice, chile and cilantro. Mix well. 2 Carefully fold in the tomatoes, then the avocado. Season to taste.
Avocado Salsa.name: Avocado Salsa

Raspberry Vinaigrette.directions: Whisk together the vinegars, lemon juice, thyme, salt, pepper and garlic. Whisk in the honey and raspberry preserves. Slowly whisk in the oils, emulsifying the dressing.
Raspberry Vinaigrette.name: Raspberry Vinaigrette

White Chicken Stock.directions: Cut the washed bones into pieces approximately 3â€“4 inches (8â€“10 centimeters) long. Place the bones in a stockpot and cover them with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.
White Chicken Stock.name: White Chicken Stock

Shortcakes.directions: Combine ingredients using the biscuit method. Cut into 3-inch (7.5-centimeter) circles and space 2 inches (5 centimeters) apart on a paper-lined sheet pan. Bake at 400Â°F (200Â°C) until lightly browned, approximately 15 to 18 minutes. Remove from the oven and brush the tops with melted butter, then sprinkle with granulated sugar.
Shortcakes.name: Shortcakes

Lamb Noisettes (3 oz).directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim lamb of all excess fat and sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut ribeye into 3 oz. noisettes. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Lamb Noisettes (3 oz).name: Lamb Noisettes (3 oz)

Rice Pilaf.directions: Place the stock in a saucepot, bring to a boil, and reduce to a simmer. Heat the butter in a second saucepot, add the onion, and sweat over medium heat until the onion begins to soften and become translucent, but not brown. Add the rice and stir until well coated with butter. Add the stock and bay leaf to the rice. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook over low heat for 18 to 20 minutes. Alternatively, place the rice in a 350Â°F (177Â°C) oven for about 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and reserve in a warm place for 5 minutes. Before service, fluff up the rice with a fork, discard the bay leaf, and serve hot. Variation for Brown Rice Pilaf The process is the same for brown rice except for the following: Increase the amount of chicken stock to 20 ounces (600 milliliters). Increase the cooking time to 30 minutes, or until the water is absorbed. NOTE: Rice is measured by volume rather than by weight. The proportion is typically 1 part rice to 2 parts liquid. Many chefs measure the amount of stock they prepare this dish with by using between 1 1/2 and 2 times the volume of stock to rice.
Rice Pilaf.name: Rice Pilaf

Thai Melon Salsa.directions: Cut the melons into small dice or shape into small balls using a parisienne scoop. Combine the remaining ingredients and toss with the melon pieces. Chill thoroughly. Serve with fish, shellfish or chicken.
Thai Melon Salsa.name: Thai Melon Salsa

Poulette Sauce.directions: SautÃ© 8 ounces (240 grams) sliced mushrooms and 1â„2 ounce (15 grams) diced shallot in 1 ounce (30 grams) whole butter. Add to the allemande; then add 2 fluid ounces (60 milliliters) heavy cream. Finish with lemon juice to taste and 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) chopped parsley. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Poulette Sauce.name: Poulette Sauce

Cream Cheese Frosting.directions: Cream the butter and cream cheese until smooth. Add the margarine and beat well. Beat in the vanilla. Slowly add the sugar, scraping down the bowl frequently. Beat until smooth.
Cream Cheese Frosting.name: Cream Cheese Frosting

Light Rye Bread.directions: Stir the flours together and set aside. To make the sponge, combine the molasses, water and yeast. Add 8 ounces (240 grams) of the flour mixture. Stir vigorously for 3 minutes. Cover the bowl and set aside to rise until doubled and very bubbly, approximately 1 hour. Stir the milk powder, caraway seeds, salt and butter into the sponge. Transfer the dough to a mixer fitted with a dough hook. Gradually add the remaining flour to the sponge. Mix on low speed and continue adding flour until the dough is stiff but slightly tacky. Knead for 5 minutes on low speed. Transfer the dough to a lightly greased bowl, cover and place in a warm place until doubled, approximately 45 to 60 minutes. Punch down the dough and divide into two pieces. Shape each piece into a round loaf and place on a sheet pan that has been dusted with cornmeal or lightly oiled. Brush the loaves with egg wash and let rise until doubled, approximately 45 minutes. Score the tops with a razor or knife. Bake at 375Â°F (190Â°C) until golden brown and crusty, approximately 25 minutes.
Light Rye Bread.name: Light Rye Bread

Southeast Asian-Style Peanut Sauce.directions: SautÃ© the garlic, onion, red pepper flakes, lime leaves, curry powder and lemongrass in the oil for 5 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir often, as the sauce can burn easily. Remove the cinnamon and bay leaves and serve warm. VARIATION: Vegetarian Peanut Sauceâ€”Substitute vegetable stock or water for the chicken stock.
Southeast Asian-Style Peanut Sauce.name: Southeast Asian-Style Peanut Sauce

Salmon Tranche (4 oz).directions: Working on a seafood designated cutting board - remove skin, pin bones, and any excess white flap. Using accurate portion scale - cut into 4 oz tranches. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Salmon Tranche (4 oz).name: Salmon Tranche (4 oz)

Italian Meringue.directions: Place 12 ounces (360 grams) sugar in a heavy saucepan with the corn syrup and water. Attach a candy thermometer to the pan and bring the sugar to a boil over high heat. Place the egg whites in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whip attachment. As the temperature of the boiling sugar approaches 220Â°F (104Â°C), begin whipping the egg whites. When the whites form soft peaks, gradually add the remaining 1 ounces (30 grams) sugar. Lower the mixer speed and continue whipping. When the sugar reaches the soft ball stage (240Â°F/116Â°C), remove it from the heat. Pour it into the whites, with the mixer running at high speed. Pour in a steady stream between the side of the bowl and the beater. Once all the sugar is incorporated, whip 1 more minute at high speed, then reduce to medium speed and whip until the meringue is cool.
Italian Meringue.name: Italian Meringue

Mousseline (Chantilly Sauce).directions: Whip 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) heavy cream until stiff. Fold it into the hollandaise just before service. Mousseline sauce is also used as a glaÃ§age coating.
Mousseline (Chantilly Sauce).name: Mousseline (Chantilly Sauce)

Chocolate Shavings.directions: PROCEDURE FOR MAKING TEMPERED CHOCOLATE SHAVINGS Spread tempered couverture chocolate evenly on a marble slab. Allow to set slightly. Using a metal dough scraper, scrape chocolate forward in a 90-degree angle with a quick mo-tion. If chocolate smears on the scraper, wait a few seconds. If it flakes, it has cooled too much. Rub a gloved hand over the chocolate surface to slightly soften it. PROCEDURE FOR MAKING UNTEMPERED CHOCOLATE SHAVINGS Select a totally flat sheet pan. Warm the sheet pan to 80Â°F (27Â°C) by placing it in a warm oven. Spread nontempered melted couverture chocolate on the back of the sheet pan. 2  Refrigerate the sheet pan until the couverture has hardened. Remove from the refrigerator. Let the chocolate soften slightly. Hold a plastic scraper at a 90-degree angle to the sheet pan and scrape 1-inch (2.5-centimeter) curls from the pan. Transfer the shavings directly onto the cake, tart or pastry. Serve as soon as possible because the untempered chocolate will bloom under refrigeration.
Chocolate Shavings.name: Chocolate Shavings

Greek-Style Scrambled Eggs.directions: Combine the eggs, cream, salt and pepper in a mixing bowl. Whisk until well blended. SautÃ© the onion in the butter until translucent but not brown. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook, stirring frequently, until half cooked, approxi-mately 1 minute. Add the spinach to the eggs and continue cooking. Just before the eggs are fully cooked, sprinkle on the feta. Spoon the cooked egg mixture onto serving plates and garnish with the olives. Serve imme-diately.
Greek-Style Scrambled Eggs.name: Greek-Style Scrambled Eggs

Veal Demi-Glace.directions: Combine the stock and sauce in a saucepan over medium heat. Simmer until the mixture is reduced by half (a yield of 1 quart or 960 mL) Strain and cool in a water bath.
Veal Demi-Glace.name: Veal Demi-Glace

Cream Cheese Filling.directions: MISE EN PLACE â–¶ Grate the lemon zest. â¶ In the bowl of a mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, blend the cream cheese and sugar on low speed until smooth. Scrape down the bowl and gradually add the eggs, scraping the bowl between each addition. â· Stir in the vanilla and lemon zest. Fold in the flour. â¸ Fill pastries with this mixture before baking.
Cream Cheese Filling.name: Cream Cheese Filling

Madeira Sauce.directions: Bring demi-glace to a boil and reduce slightly. Then add 4 fluid ounces (120 milliliters) Madeira wine. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Madeira Sauce.name: Madeira Sauce

Classic Chocolate Mousse.directions: Melt the chocolate and butter in a double boiler over low heat. Stir until no lumps remain. Allow the mixture to cool slightly, then whisk in the egg yolks one at a time. Beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Slowly beat in the sugar and continue beating until stiff peaks form. Whisk one-fourth of the whipped egg whites into the chocolate mixture to lighten, then fold in the remaining whites. Whip the cream to soft peaks. Allow the mousse to cool to 90Â°Fâ€“95Â°F (32Â°Câ€“35Â°C), then fold in the whipped cream. Make sure no streaks of egg white or cream remain. Spoon the mousse into serving bowls and garnish with whipped cream, fresh berries, shaved chocolate or mint. Or chill the mousse completely, then pipe it into bowls or baked tartlet shells. The mousse may also be used as a cake or pastry filling.
Classic Chocolate Mousse.name: Classic Chocolate Mousse

Grapefruit Sorbet.directions: Combine the juice and sugar. Process in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturerâ€™s directions. Pack into a clean container and freeze until firm. VARIATIONS: Mango Sorbetâ€”Combine 2.2 pounds (1 kilogram) mango purÃ©e with 8 fluid ounces (240 millili-ters) medium sugar syrup. Raspberry Sorbetâ€”Combine 2.2 pounds (1 kilogram) purÃ©ed, strained raspberries with 1 pound (500 grams) granulated sugar and 1 fluid ounce (30 milliliters) lemon juice.
Grapefruit Sorbet.name: Grapefruit Sorbet

Tournedos (3 oz).directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim tenderloin of the chain, excess fat and the sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into 3 oz tournedos. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Tournedos (3 oz).name: Tournedos (3 oz)

Chocolate Spongecake.directions: MISE EN PLACE â–º Preheat oven to 350Â°F (180Â°C). â–º Sift flour. â¶ Butter the bottom and sides of two 9-inch (22-centimeter) cake pans. Let the butter cool, then flour the pans. Set aside. â· Separate the eggs, placing the yolks and the whites in separate mixing bowls. Whip the egg yolks and 5 Â½ ounces (60 grams) of the sugar on medium speed until thick, pale and at least doubled in volume, approximately 3 to 5 minutes. The yolks should be whipped until ribbons form. â¸ Place the bowl of egg whites on a mixer fitted with a clean whip attachment and beat on medium speed until foamy. Gradually add the remaining sugar and vanilla. Whip at medium speed until the whites are glossy and hold firm peaks but are not dry. â¹ Pour the egg yolks onto the whipped whites. Quickly fold the two mixtures together. âº Sprinkle one-third of the sifted flour over the batter and delicately fold in. Repeat the procedure until all the flour is incorporated. Do not overmix; fold just until incorporated. â» Pour the batter into the prepared pans, smoothing the surface as needed. Bake at 350Â°F (180Â°C) until the cakes are golden brown and bounce back when lightly pressed in the center, approximately 25 minutes. â¼ Allow the cakes to cool on a wire rack for 10 to 15 minutes before unmolding. â½ To remove the cakes from their pans, run a thin metal spatula around the edge of each pan if necessary. When the cake is completely cool, it can be frosted or wrapped in plastic and frozen for 2 to 3 months. VARIATION: Chocolate Spongecakeâ€”Reduce the flour to 5.5 ounces (165 grams/78%). Sift it together with 1.75 ounces (50 grams/25%) cocoa powder and 1.75 ounces (50 grams/25%) powdered sugar. Fold in as described in Step 5.
Chocolate Spongecake.name: Chocolate Spongecake

Fish Velout\u00c3\u00a9.directions: Heat the butter in a heavy saucepan. Add the flour and cook to make a blond roux. Gradually add the stock to the roux, stirring constantly with a whisk to prevent lumps. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. (Seasonings are optional; their use depends on the season-ings in the stock and the sauceâ€™s intended use.) Simmer and reduce to 1 gallon (3.8 liters), approximately 30 minutes. Strain through a china cap lined with cheesecloth. Melted butter may be carefully ladled over the surface of the sauce to prevent a skin from forming. Hold for service or cool in a water bath.
Fish Velout\u00c3\u00a9.name: Fish VeloutÃ©

New York Cheesecake.directions: Combine the graham cracker crumbs with the melted butter. Press the mixture into the bot-tom of two 8-inch (20-centimeter) round springform pans. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes at 375Â°F (180Â°C) until the crust is dry to the touch. Set aside. Blend the cream cheese and sugar on low speed in the bowl of a mixer fitted with the paddle attachment until no lumps remain. Scrape down the bowl often. Add the eggs one at a time, waiting for each egg to be fully incorporated before adding more. Scrape down the bowl and paddle between each addition. Add the flour and mix until combined. Add the remaining ingredients and mix to blend. Divide the cheesecake batter evenly between the two pans. Wrap the bottom and sides of each pan in several layers of aluminum foil. Preheat the oven to 300Â°F (150Â°C). Place the batter-filled pans in a hotel pan and set the hotel pan in the preheated oven. Pour in enough water to come halfway up the sides of the pans. Bake until the batter is set and no longer trembles, approximately 75 to 90 minutes. Cool the cakes on a wire rack in their pans, then refrigerate them overnight. Remove the cakes from the pan.
New York Cheesecake.name: New York Cheesecake

Chicken Soup With Matzo Balls.directions: Simmer the chicken in the stock for 2 hours, skimming as necessary. Add the mirepoix and sachet. Simmer for another hour. Strain and degrease the broth. Adjust seasonings. Bring to a boil at service time. Portion into heated bowls and garnish with chopped parsley and one or two Matzo Balls.
Chicken Soup With Matzo Balls.name: Chicken Soup With Matzo Balls

Scrambled Eggs.directions: Combine the eggs, cream, salt and pepper in a mixing bowl. Whisk until well blended. Heat the butter in a sautÃ© pan. Pour the egg mixture into the hot pan and cook, stirring frequently, until set, approximately 2 minutes. The eggs should be set, but still shiny and moist.
Scrambled Eggs.name: Scrambled Eggs

White Veal Stock.directions: Cut the washed bones into pieces approximately 3â€“4 inches (8â€“10 centimeters) long. Place the bones in a stockpot and cover them with cold water. If blanching, bring the water to a boil, skimming off the scum that rises to the surface. Drain off the water and the impurities. Then add the 3 gallons (11.5 liters) cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. If not blanching the bones, bring the cold water to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and skim the scum that forms. Add the mirepoix and sachet to the simmering stock. Continue simmering and skimming the stock for 6 to 8 hours. (If only chicken bones are used, simmer for 3 to 4 hours.) Strain, cool and refrigerate.
White Veal Stock.name: White Veal Stock

Pork Tenderloin Medallions (2 oz).directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim pork tenderloin of any fat or silverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut into 2 oz medallions. Place in hotel pan or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
Pork Tenderloin Medallions (2 oz).name: Pork Tenderloin Medallions (2 oz)

Bavarian Cream.directions: To prepare the custard sauce, combine the milk, cream, 2 ounces (60 grams) sugar and the vanilla bean in a heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil. Whisk the egg yolks and remaining 4 ounces (120 grams) sugar together to the ribbon stage. Temper the yolk mixture with one-quarter of the heated milk, whisking constantly. Pour the egg mixture into the saucepan with the rest of the milk. Stir constantly with a rubber spatula until the custard reaches 185Â°F (85Â°C). Remove the custard from the heat and pour it through a fine mesh strainer into a clean bowl. Add the softened gelatin to the hot custard. Chill until thick in an ice bath, until the custard reaches 75Â°F (24Â°C) or slightly cooler. Fold in the whipped cream. Pour the Bavarian cream immediately into serving dishes or a ladyfinger-lined mold. Chill completely before serving. Note: Gelatin may separate in the freezer, so quick chilling is not recommended. Products made with gelatin keep well for 1 to 2 days but stiffen with age. VARIATION: Charlotte Bavarianâ€”Line a 2â€“21/2-quart (2â€“2.5-liter) charlotte mold with ladyfingers (page 1043), then fill with alternating layers of fruit and Bavarian cream. Chill completely, then invert onto a serving platter when firm and garnish with whipped cream.
Bavarian Cream.name: Bavarian Cream

Cream Beurre Blanc.directions: SautÃ© the shallot in the clarified butter until translucent but not brown. Add the wine and re-duce by half. Add the cream, bring to a boil and reduce by two-thirds. Remove from the heat and keep warm. Whisk the butter into the sauce in several batches. Move the pan back and forth over the heat to keep the sauce from becoming too hot or too cold. Season the sauce with salt and white pepper. Strain if desired. Hold in a warm place for ser-vice
Cream Beurre Blanc.name: Cream Beurre Blanc

Boeuf \u00c3\u00a0 la Ficelle (Beef Poac.directions: Tie the tenderloins, leaving long strings on each end. Place the white wine, carrots, baby turnips, pearl onions, celery, mushroom caps, potatoes and bouquet garni in a 6-quart (6-liter) saucepot. Add the stock, bring to a simmer and cook 5 minutes. Add the tenderloins to the stock and vegetables, tying the long strings to the handles of the pot so the meat is fully submerged and is not sitting on the bottom. Reduce the heat and poach the tenderloins for 15 to 20 minutes or until rare. Remove the tenderloins from the cooking liquid and remove the string. Simmer the vegeta-bles in the cooking liquid until done and remove with a slotted spoon. Reduce the cooking liquid to concentrate its flavor as desired. Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper and add the port wine. MontÃ© au beurre. Slice the tenderloin and present on plates or platters with the vegetables. Immediately before serving, ladle a portion of the hot broth over the tenderloin and vegetables. Garnish with chives. Serve additional broth and mustard separately.
Boeuf \u00c3\u00a0 la Ficelle (Beef Poac.name: Boeuf Ã  la Ficelle (Beef Poached on a String)

Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Fra\u00c3\u00aeche.directions: Heat the cream to approximately 100Â°F (43Â°C). Remove the cream from the heat and stir in the buttermilk. Allow the mixture to stand in a warm place, loosely covered, until it thickens, approximately 12 to 36 hours. Chill thoroughly before using. CrÃ¨me fraÃ®che will keep for up to 10 days in the refrigerator.
Cr\u00c3\u00a8me Fra\u00c3\u00aeche.name: CrÃ¨me FraÃ®che

French Onion Soup.directions: SautÃ© the onions in the butter over low heat. Carefully caramelize them thoroughly without burning. Deglaze the pan with 8 fluid ounces (240 milliliters) beef stock. Cook au sec. Repeat this process until the onions are a very dark, even brown. Add the remaining beef stock and the chicken stock and thyme. Bring to a simmer and cook 20 minutes to develop flavor. Adjust the seasonings and add the sherry. Serve in warm bowls. Top each portion with a slice of toasted French bread and a thick layer of cheese. Place under the broiler or salamander until the cheese is melted and lightly browned.
French Onion Soup.name: French Onion Soup

Challah.directions: Stir together the honey, salt and 8 ounces (240 grams) flour in a mixer bowl. Dissolve the yeast in the hot water. Add the yeast mixture, warm water, eggs and butter to the mixer bowl. Stir until smooth. Using a dough hook, knead the dough on medium speed, adding the remaining flour 2 ounces (60 grams) at a time until smooth and elastic, approximately 5 minutes. Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl, cover and let the dough ferment until doubled, ap-proximately 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Punch down the dough and divide into six equal portions. Roll each portion into a long strip, about 1 inch (2.5 centimeters) in diameter and 12 inches (30 centimeters) long. Lay three strips side by side and braid. Pinch the ends together, then roll the ends of the braid to seal. Tuck the ends under the loaf. Place the loaf on a paper-lined sheet pan. Braid the three remaining pieces of dough in the same manner. Place the loaves on a paper-lined sheet pan. Brush the loaves with egg wash and sprinkle with sesame or poppy seeds. Proof until doubled, approximately 45 minutes. Bake at 350Â°F (170Â°C) until the loaves are golden brown and sound hollow when thumped, approximately 40 minutes.
Challah.name: Challah

Shortbread Tart Dough.directions: Press the egg yolks through a sieve using a plastic pastry scraper. Set aside. Using a mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter. Add the sugar, combining well. Add the vanilla extract, salt and almond or hazelnut flour, then the sieved egg yolks, and mix until combined. Add all of the pastry flour and mix on low speed just until combined. Do not overmix. Wrap the dough in plastic and chill for several hours or overnight. When ready to use, roll out the chilled dough on a lightly floured board. The dough may be crumbly and difficult to work with, which is normal. Simply press the dough back together with your fingertips.
Shortbread Tart Dough.name: Shortbread Tart Dough

Caramel Filling.directions: 1 Bring the butter, 4 ounces (120 grams) of sugar and the cream to a boil. Set aside. 2 In a separate large saucepan, warm the glucose until it liquefies. Add the remaining sugar. 3 Continue heating the glucose and sugar until the mixture caramelizes to a dark brown. Turn off the heat. 4 Slowly add the cream mixture to the caramel. Be very careful, as this will bubble wildly. Also, to avoid steam burns, do not place your hands above the boiling caramel. When the boiling begins to subside, stir with a wooden spoon. Repeat this process until all of the cream has been added. 5 Return the pan to the heat and cook to a temperature of 236Â°F (113Â°C). Strain and allow to cool thoroughly before using.
Caramel Filling.name: Caramel Filling

New York Strip Steak (10 oz).directions: Working on a meat-designated cutting board - trim meat of all excess fat and sliverskin. Using accurate portion scale, cut strip loin into 10 oz steaks. Place in hotel pans or paper-lined sheet pan. Cover with plastic wrap, label with date, and place in walk-in refrigerator.
New York Strip Steak (10 oz).name: New York Strip Steak (10 oz)
